story:
Between October 1st and November 24, 2012, hundreds of individuals will join Centro de los Derechos del Migrante, Inc. in our Cien Cenas campaign.  As a part of this campaign, individuals cross the United States, Mexico, and beyond will come to together to celebrate the lives of migrant workers and their families. These individuals will help Centro de los Derechos del Migrante, Inc. to raise awareness about migrant workers’ rights and commemorate the migrant workers who have lost their lives while employed in the US.  

Thousands of female migrant workers travel to the United States each year.  Many of these women flee their countries of origin to escape violence and poverty, only to experience violence in migration and while working in the United States.  Like other migrant workers, some of these women suffer fatalities during the course of their employment in the United States.  This year’s Cien Cenas campaign will honor the lives of the migrant women who have died.

Help CDM fight for migrant rights by making a donation.  Your donation will help us defend migrant rights while paying homage to the amazing contributions migrant workers make to the US economy, culture, and social fabric while they risk their lives in low-wage, high-risk workplaces across the United States.

CDM is the first transnational legal organization dedicated to helping migrant workers to remove the border as a barrier to justice by helping them seek redress for the labor violations and exploitation that they suffer while working in the United States.  CDM's headquarters is located in Mexico City, Mexico.  It also has a U.S. office in Baltimore, Maryland. 

We provide direct legal services to migrant workers, along with educational tools about their rights and advocacy.

Thank you for your contribution and for supporting migrant worker rights.  If you'd like to participate in the Cien Cenas campaign, please email Ingrid Hernandez-Ardieta Boix at ingrid@cdmigrante.org

story:
Hello friends,

Thanks so much for your interest in the historic Players Barn! Things are moving forward, but we could use your help.

As you may know, the Players Barn has been a landmark in the village of Peninsula, OH since the early 1900s. Through the years it's welcomed numerous community theater productions, distinguished guests, artisans and musicians, antique dealers and others within its still-sturdy walls.

Although the Players Barn sat empty for a number of years, the Peninsula Players Barn Committee (PPBC) has recently formed with the goal of supporting the Barn's preservation, renovation and future activity. We hope to restore this theatrical gem to its former vibrancy and eventually create space for civic, cultural and artistic endeavors.

We've busy coordinating future fundraising events (more details to come) but right now our efforts are directed toward one main goal: to raise $550 by July 9th to pay for our 501(c)(3) application. This will allow the PPBC to incorporate as a non-profit organization and begin fundraising in earnest!

If you can't make a donation before July 9th, there are 2 other ways you can help:

1) Join, "like" and link to our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/playersbarn
2) Write a note of support -- post it to our Facebook page or email it to playersbarn@gmail.com

Please share this fundraising campaign with others who may be interested. Thank you for being a friend to the Players Barn -- preservation efforts won't happen without your help!

With thanks,
The Peninsula Players Barn Committee

story:
We are Quen and Sam, two very passionate entrepreneurs, and true Battle Buddies. We are both Active Duty National Guard. We met in 2008 when we were deploying to Iraq, and we have been great friends ever since. When we returned from overseas, we saw that the economy had plummeted. Everything was different from when we left; it was harder to find and keep employment for everyone. So, we had been searching constantly for the right business venture to embark on together; since we know that if we can go to war together, we would definitely be able to run a business together.

We finally found the right opportunity: a Restaurant Marketing and Delivery service. We officially opened Express Waiter in September 2011 in the Dallas/ Ft worth area. Having our business has been a dream come true for the both of us!  We have had many bumps in the road to entrepreneurship, but we wouldn’t change it for the world.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Since we have started our business, we have been funding everything for Express Waiter from our Active Duty paychecks. And we have met many people that help us out of the kindness of their hearts. One of our employees, for example, has worked for us for FREE the entire time we have been open, simply because she believes in us and our business. We try our hardest to provide for her everything she and her daughter needs for day to day life, but we’re sure that she would love to get paid. We really would love to show our gratitude for Amber and all the things she has done for us, so a portion of the money we receive in this campaign will go towards Amber and her selfless dedication to our business.

We would also utilize the money from this campaign to fund additional advertising and various business expenses. We need to print Menu Guides, Menu Cards and different print materials to send out to our customers to promote Express Waiter.  We have been paying for everything so far ourselves, but we just need a little help.

When you donate to our campaign, we will show our appreciation with lots of military memorabilia.

THE IMPACT

When we started our business, we sought out all the veterans benefits we were told were available to us, however, we found that those benefits weren’t as easily attainable as we thought. So, we want to make sure our business is a success so that we can spread the word to other veterans as to how they can start a successful business with or without veterans’ benefits. With a 12% unemployment rate for veterans who come home from deployments, we want to minimize that number and show them that they can be successful.

With our business, we also want to bring awareness to the Restaurant Marketing and Delivery Industry, because there are MANY companies like ours around the country. No longer are you limited to only Pizza or Chinese for delivery! We want customers and restaurants to know about the quality, convenience and variety that services like ours provide.

 OTHER WAYS YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE

If you can’t contribute with money, no problem! All we ask is that you spread the word via Facebook, Twitter, email, YouTube, or however you choose! Just get the word out to help not only our campaign, but other deserving campaigns on Indiegogo. Thanks for all your support! HOOAH!!

story: It is here once again. The Fourth of July and that means the Culver Family annual party. Every year has been great and lots of fun. This year is going to be no different. In 2012 we were able to pull together and purchase The Big Bang package. What a night of fun it provided. So this year we are looking to pull together again to get that package once again. For anyone who does donate please come to the house and join us that evening for the show and dessert. You can reach me on face book at facebook.com/samuelculver for the address. And if you just wish to come by and join us please do. I hope you all have a fun and happy Fourth of July where ever you are.
story_txt: It is here once again. The Fourth of July and that means the Culver Family annual party. Every year has been great and lots of fun. This year is going to be no different. In 2012 we were able to pull together and purchase The Big Bang package. What a night of fun it provided. So this year we are looking to pull together again to get that package once again. For anyone who does donate please come to the house and join us that evening for the show and dessert. You can reach me on face book at facebook.com/samuelculver for the address. And if you just wish to come by and join us please do. I hope you all have a fun and happy Fourth of July where ever you are.

story:
North Adams is a place where dreams and aspirations can become epic realities. A small city formerly a boom town has slowly been transformed into an arts and tourism based diamond in the rough, tucked away in the northernmost corner of the Berkshire Mountain range. With it's beautiful downtown and shifting culture, North Adams is currently lacking high quality, "walkable" foods, in an area where strolling around and perusing the local signs and sounds would by all accounts be logical.

That's where we come in! Oh Crepe! is a big dream, turned project on the brink of successful launch. Emily and Ben are the dreamer, foodie, ignition points of what was perviously only a fanciful thought. They are going to bring a locally sourced, affordable, and "walkable" food purveyor in the center of Downtown North Adams to fruition! And you can help! 

 

With the goal of serving made to order crepes, including breakfast, lunch and dessert varieties, Oh Crepe! will bring the long needed option for both locals and visitors alike. Imagine grabbing a crepe and strolling through local art galleries and shops, or taking a ride up the highest peak in Massachusetts with crepe in hand, or perhaps taking crepes on a picnic with you at any of the beautiful locales in the rolling hills of the area, or even just eating in and watching the world go by in Downtown North Adams, in the rolling Berkshires. Filling bellies with high quality, affordable food, fair trade and high quality coffee, and enhancing the culinary experience of both locals and visitors alike is what it's all about.

This Indiegogo will help make this venture an even greater success than what we can build ourselves. We are prepared to take out loans for as much as we need, but we want this to be a community effort, whereby a collection of people show that this is something they see as something they want and NEED!

Funds raised will go towards purchasing crepe, coffee and tea making equipment, making infrastructure upgrades to fit code and space needs, purchasing signage for the exterior of the building, and replacing flooring, wiring, plumbing and counters in the space. We already have space tentatively contracted, recipes to kick some tastebud butt, and a plan of execution for something amazing, all we need now is the capital to get us over the last hurdle. Donations beyond our minimum needs will be instrumental in getting the highest quality equipment and materials needed to make the experience of Oh Crepe! as amazing as the food we'll make!

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit us when we open! Help support local food and do it in the NAMAzing city of North Adams, MA. 

Share our Indiegogo, visit our Facebook, and make some noise to help make Oh Crepe! as awesome as it can be! 

Risks and Challenges

As with any restaurant venture, there is always a fear of failed business. That being said, Ben and Emily both have extensive experience in business, community building, and program development, as well as a number of years in food service management and retail sales. 

We've selected a space with high foot traffic in the heart of downtown, local vendors to source high quality, sustainable resources, a design with low overhead and maximized potential output, and a menu to fit the tastes and wallets of everyone. There will always be challenges, but we are ready at arms to take them on and make this a blaring success!

story:
Dear Friends of Maria Marcoli

In the days of Valiant Petroleum plc, we were lucky enough to work with and to get to know Maria.

It goes without saying perhaps, that Maria will be remembered by all who knew her, both friends and colleagues alike, as a warm hearted, generous, thoughtful, diligent, hard working, wonderfully funny, loyal and altogether beautiful person.

For someone so young and so special to be taken from her family and friends so suddenly, we want very much to be able to do something in lasting memory here in Woking, the place Maria and her family called home.

Memorial Bench
Early in 2014 Maria, Carlo and Gloria moved into a lovely house which Maria had put lots of energy and care into, making it their perfect first family house.

The house overlooks the cricket pitch, greens and trees of Woking Park, and it is here that we would like to have a Memorial Bench positioned, with a plaque in her memory.

We have chosen this in particular as a symbol of our deepest esteem and affection for Maria, and as something that we hope her family and friends will be able to visit in years to come.

What We Need
In order to make this happen we would like to invite anyone who would like to and is able to contribute to the purchasing of the bench and installation of the plaque, by making a contribution, however big or small.  The total of the fundraising goal is specifically for this purpose.

SADS UK - Funds Raised Over and Above the Target
Thank you to everyone who has so generously contributed to the campaign, raising everything needed, and more, to secure the memorial. We will be forever grateful.

To support the charity for SADS - Sudden Arrhythmic Death Syndrome - the condition which took Maria from her family and friends, we will be donating all funds raised over and above the target to SADS UK, the charity who do so much to raise awareness and to support families directly affected:-

http://sadsuk.org.uk/newsite/

The Unveiling
We hope very much that you will be able to join us for the unveiling of the Memorial Bench in just a few months, on a date to be determined. 

Memory Book for Gloria

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

We are putting together a Memory Book of photographs to give to Gloria, who has just turned two, and we would love to fill it with photos you might have of Maria over the time you knew her.

If you do have any photos you would like to include, please do get in touch or simply email them to us at: nuala_bennetts@hotmail.com

THANK YOU & PLEASE SHARE THIS WITH ANYONE WHO KNEW MARIA

story:
Bonjour, je m’appelle Michael, j’habite Montréal, au Canada et je suis présentement dans la ville de Sokodé au Togo en Afrique de l’Ouest où je passe l’été 2014 afin d’accomplir un stage de développement d’activité économique génératrice de revenu chapeauté par l’organisme en stage d’éducation international Horizon Cosmopolite en partenariat avec Carrefour de Solidarité International CSI/Togo. Mon objectif est d’aider une dizaine d’agriculteurs et d’entrepreneurs de la région à accroître leur productivité et leur rentabilité donc conséquemment leur revenus.

Plus particulièrement, l’objectif de cette campagne de financement participative est de ramasser les fonds nécessaires à l’achat d’outils de base et des structures essentielles au bon fonctionnement des activités. Parmi les dix groupements, il y en a deux qui produisent l’huile de palme, deux autres qui fabriquent le savon, deux cultivateurs maraîchers, un éleveur de porcs et de volailles, un cultivateur de champignon, un apiculteur et un boucher. Il ne faut pas non plus oublier le coordinateur responsable du projet M. Agate Agbang.

Les besoins et les projets de chacun de ces groupements sont nombreux. Par exemple, les productrices de savon (les deux groupes sont constitués de plus de trente femmes au total) ont besoin de moules en métal et de table de coupe adéquat afin d’obtenir des pains de savon uniformes. Les deux groupements qui produisent l’huile de palme sont aussi constitués que de femmes, une centaine au total. Certaines brisent à la main chacune des noix, un moulin concasseur serait le bienvenu pour faciliter le travail. Le cultivateur de champignon, M.Katcho, a besoin d’une pièce hermétique et aseptisé qui permettra la culture du mycélium. Les agriculteurs maraîchers, qui comptent une dizaine de membres par groupe, sarclent à la main la totalité de la superficie de leurs champs de riz, de maïs ou de sésame. L’acquisition d’équipement motorisé transformerait positivement la productivité de la récolte. M. Simda, l’éleveur de poules pondeuses a besoin d’une chambre froide pour conserver ses œufs au frais. Pour l’apiculteur, l’ajout de ruches est toujours un plus pour améliorer la récolte du miel. Et pour assurer une coordination et un suivi de tous ces groupements, un transport efficace s’impose pour rejoindre chaque entrepreneur et cultivateur sur l’étendue du territoire de Sokodé.

 

Les sommes ramassées serviront directement les entrepreneurs et cultivateurs, car elles permettront l’achat d’équipement ou le financement de plans plus imposants. Le Projet Sokodé s’engage en contrepartie à offrir à chaque donateur la chance d’être remercier personnellement selon l’importance de l’investissement ; voyez, ci-contre, le détail de chacun des dons possibles.

Il n’y a pas que l’argent qui compte. La grande force des campagnes de financement participative est la diffusion rapide par l’entremise des réseaux sociaux et informatiques. Si vous ne donner pas d’argent, donnez-nous au moins la chance d’être vu par vos contacts. Faites passer le Projet Sokodé à vos amis.

story:
Short Summary

There are more than 8,000 births to teenagers in Indiana every year. 7% of all teen girls in the United States will give birth before they turn 20. The problems and challenges that affect teen parents are tremendous:

-Only 40 percent of teen moms ever finish high school and less than two percent finish college by age 30.

-Teen moms are more likely to experience unemployment and live in poverty; to be depressed later in life; and to be single parents.

-Children of teen mothers are 50 percent more likely to repeat a grade, less likely to complete high school, and have lower performance on standardized tests than those born to older parents.

-A child’s chance of growing up in poverty is nine times greater if the parents were unmarried and the mother did not receive a high school diploma - both common among teen mothers.

 One of the most significant challenges facing teen mothers is completing high school. Without the support and skills to balance both motherhood and schoolwork, it becomes difficult for teen mothers to focus on their education, which is why only 40 percent of teen mothers ever finish high school. They are more likely than other mothers to experience unemployment and live in poverty.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $10,000 to be able to get the full impact from a $10,000 grant that we have received to buy equipment and supplies. What we offer to you is the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of both teen parents and their children. Research says that there is a $14.00 return to the community for every dollar spent on early childhood education. That means that this $10,000 could boost the local, state and national economy by $140,000. You can know for certain that your contribution will make changes in the lives of the participants - both parents and children.

The Impact

CRADLES of Clay County is a replication of the CRADLES ministry that was started in Henry County, Indiana 15 years ago. During that time 90% of the teen parents enrolled in the program progressed in their education - graduating from high school, getting their GED, progressing to the next grade (but leaving CRADLES prior to graduation). 

CRADLES of Clay County envisions student parents taking their place in local communities as self-sufficient citizens within healthy family units. CRADLES will support student parents pursuing an education by providing developmentally appropriate childcare, parenting and life skills education, and mentoring. CRADLES breaks the cycle of poverty and prevents some from entering the cycle of poverty.

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk that we face is that another generation of teen parents - both mothers and fathers - will transition into adulthood without enough support to be successful in parenting and in life.

One of the challenges that we face is needing to raise more funds than what we envisioned when we started this process. Most of our teen parents are eligible for a childcare voucher which would help them pay for the developmentally appropriate childcare that will be provided by CRADLES of Clay County but the State of Indiana has recently frozen those funds and our commitment is that our teen parents will only pay $10 a week for the childcare provide. Can you imagine the financial struggle it would be to a teen parent to pay $100 or more a week for childcare?

Our program has already been approved by the local school system. We have staff that are trained and ready to start working with the student parents and their children. We have the use of two locations that are being donated to us rent free. We are awaiting inspection by the state's childcare department but are confident that both sites will be approved.

We need your help in meeting our goal of $10,000 by the end of September but reaching it sooner would be great.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Here are some things that you can do to help that go beyond your pocket book:

    Pray for us, specifically that we would be able to help each parent and child to make positive decisions for life and start or continue on a life of balanced growth;

    Promote this campaign to your friends on social media, via email, on the phone, whatever way you can;

    Volunteer to be a mentor or a childcare assistant if you live close enough;

    Invite us to come or video chat with you and a group of friends about CRADLES.

    And if you think of other options, send us an email - cradlescc@gmail.com - and we will see if your idea works.

story:
Hello Indiegogo people!

My name is Shane Ellis. I'm a WWOOFer from Ashtabula, OH. I left home last April to meet and learn from people who are living off the grid, or living in intentional communities, and attempting to make a positive difference in this world. I decided to spend the last six months volunteering and working for room and board all across the country. 

I've worked with four different WWOOF host farms in Texas, New Mexico, and California. I volunteered at the Stone Fruit Jubilee this summer. I've participated in two separate weekly K-8 school garden programs since classes began this year. I plan to travel south for an organic olive harvest in the coming weeks to help a small organic olive oil business.

I'm in Brentwood, California now helping the First Generation Farmers. We are a community farm set up so that anyone can come out and learn about organic farming and take home free produce. We do a farmers market in Brentwood every weekend where you pay what you can afford for food. It's all donation based.

I'm trying to get a job with Vail Ski Resorts in South Lake Tahoe for the winter to make some money back to be able to continue to volunteer across the country in 2015. I am running out of money but have an interview over the phone  with them October 1st! Unfortunately employee housing may already be filled and I will likely have to return home to Ohio to search for work this winter. If I can get enough funding through this campaign I will be able to visit my mother for the holidays and return to North Fork to work with the Kerns again this spring. 

Working for room and board has been one of the most rewarding experiences of my life. Traveling across the country helping strangers who become friends and family has proven to me that I can make a positive difference in this world using my hands and free will to do what is right. It's important to be interested in where your food comes from. Volunteering on organic family farms, and organic community farms for nothing more than a bed and some food is and isn't a sustainable lifestyle. At some point I have to pay for transportation and buy a new pair of shoes : (

That's why I'm trying this out. Please help me if you can. I can't wait to help you back! 

If I reach my goal I promise to continue to use my time to help the people out there who want to grow good organic food, and be charitable in every way that I can with my energy and choices. 

I also promise to continue to search for employment so that I can continue to support my cause as well. 

Not being able to contribute or not wanting to is just fine! Please share this with people you know who might be able to help me or would also be willing to spread the word. 

Thank you everybody.

Please share this with people you know who might be able to help me or would also be willing to spread the word. Thank you everybody.

story:
The A3 Vertical Grow System by Leo Tek Inc.

  • The A3 Vertical Grow System can be built to Hydroponics and Aquaponics specifications. 
  • The A3 Vertical Grow System can serve farmers all over the world, and also fight world hunger.
  • The A3 Vertical Grow System is currently patent pending.
  • The A3 Vertical Grow System specializes in maximizing the seasonal output by allowing 3-4 additional harvests.
  • The A3 Vertical Grow System increases harvest 10X compared to traditional farming methods.
  • Water is cycled in the system and is reused which means daily watering is not needed. 
  • Each Aquaponics A3 System allows for approximately 1000 fish to be farmed.
  • Each A3 System only requires labor for set up and crop harvest.
  • The A3 Vertical Grow System can grow, but not limited to the following:
    • oBulb Type Plants
      • ♣Tulips
      • ♣Dahlias
      • ♣Lilly’s
      • ♣Onion
      • ♣Garlic
      • ♣Green Onion
    • Root Type Plants
      • ♣Potato
      • ♣Yam
      • ♣Radish
      • ♣Turnip
    • Bush Type Plants
      • ♣Bush Beans
      • ♣Peppers
      • ♣Tomatoes
      • ♣Strawberries
      • ♣Summer Squash
      • ♣Berries
      • ♣Herbs
Podcast:Podcast Interview

The A3 Vertical Grow System by Leo Tek Inc.- We plan on Revolutionizing Agriculture!

We currently have one row up and running on a 100 acre farm land in Longmont, Colorado. However we have a few goals we want to achieve. If we can make it through each of these goals we will prove the following:


  1. That the pump can effectively generate water flow to up to at least Three of our vertical rows so that the plants can receive sufficient nutrients and hydration.
  2. That the Vertical Grow system is effective in fall and winter. We wish to prove we can grow vegetables under 50 degree weather without losing more than 10% crop. If we can achieve growing in 20 degree weather we can guarantee certain regions of the USA and other parts of the world can farm outdoors All Year Round!
  3. That the heat trace works, and the A3 Vertical Grow System can effectively work in freezing temperatures.
  4. That the A3 Vertical Grow System requires roughly 1/4 of the personnel to harvest and maintain the system on a larger scale compared to traditional farming methods.
  5. That the frame can be made out of stainless steel for durability and longevity.


Alexander Woods-Leo, President and CEO

Founder of Leo Tek Inc., a Diversified Holdings Company revolutionizing the world of Agriculture and Technology. Mr. Leo is an innovater and advocate for life-changing technology.

Justin Williams, Director of Agriculture

Inventor of the Patent Pending "A3 Vertical Grow System" and manager of the Leo Tek Inc. farm. 

Jonathan Bloomfield, Director of Business Development

Responsible for overall company growth and development. 


What We Need

In order to build 5 more rows we will need the following:

  • Class 200 PVC
  • Specialized Pump
  • Fittings
  • Hose Clamps
  • Concrete
  • Stainless Steel
  • Back hoe
  • Welder Machine
  • Generator
  • Plant cups


The Impact


Leo Tek Inc. is trying to change the agriculture game. We have successfully utilized the one row we have built and working to grow 311 heads of lettuce. Currently we are trying the system with Lemon Basil and Purple Basil. With each test we are realizing that we are able to grow roughly 10x more in the same space that "conventional farming" allows for. We also know we can harvest an additional 3-4 times per season than "conventional farming". Further more, we actually have 10% more water return in the summer months in our 1300 gallon reservoir. So our beginning estimates of using 75% of the water compared to conventional farming were shattered! We not only used less water but we actually gained water! This Vertical System is challenging the way farming can be done. It is also a green friendly system where solar can be used to power the system. For every 10 degrees below 50 degrees we can successfully grow healthy sell able produce and we will be able to expand the areas in the USA and around the world that will allow outdoor farming without the need of greenhouses and indoor growing facilities! Our A3 Vertical Grow System is without a doubt a life altering growing machine to feed hungry mouths around the world who don't have access to healthy food! To go even further with our system, if we can produce in even 20 degree weather then we will literally open up most every state and country to grow outdoors all year round! This will most likely drive the cost of fresh produce down due to easier accessibility combined with a cost effective solution for small time and commercial farmers to grow and sell larger quantities of herbs, vegetables, and flowers!

Why is this project important to the backers!


Everyone eats food! Everyone pays for food! Most people do not eat enough fruits and vegetables, and poverty-stricken areas of the world do not eat enough because they simply cannot afford the price for quality produce. This system impacts everyone on this planet, all 7,000,000,000 of us! Being a backer in this project will literally bring the world that much closer to a better life!
  • For every $20.00 donated Leo Tek Inc. will donate 1 pound of produce to a local food bank.

Risks & Challenges


Leo Tek Inc. understands that we may not be able to grow in the months of November to March. If we cannot grow all year round then we want to understand the temperature lows that this system allows for productive growth in our harvest. To do this we will have a temperature tracking system set up starting in September and this will document the temperature ranges and times that the plants were exposed to those ranges. 

We will have a heat trace installed in every row as to help keep the water at a temperature that we deem productive for the plants being grown. Also the reservior will have a water heater to keep the water source from freezing up and allow the water to be pumped through the intake tube into the channels to deliver the nutrients to the plants.

Leo Tek Inc. has a director of Agriculture that is also the inventor of the A3 Vertical Grow System. Justin Williams, the inventor has 15 years of experience with Hydroponics systems. He is also the founder of an indoor farming company named "Grow Up Denver". Justin Williams has spent many years developing the system, and fully understand the Hydroponics industry .

Other Ways You Can Help

If people cant contribute money, and see this as a great opportunity that impacts everyone. Please feel free to pass this project along to friends and family, or even on your twitter, Facebook, and linked In. The more noise we make the better! The more we attempt to take the risk to change things for the better the more eyes will draw to the prize! Eventually the right pair of eyes will have the resources to contribute monetarily. If Leo Tek Inc. should not reach our goal, then we will still be able to contribute the capital to building at least 1 new row.

Company Website: www.leotekholdings.com

Add us on Twitter @Roarsoft

Company Linked In. https://www.linkedin.com/company/3056058?trk=pr...

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Pennsylvania Lawyers for Youth, a verified nonprofit. 

www.palawyersforyouth.org

Who We Are

Pennsylvania Lawyers for Youth (PALY) provides educational rights counseling and assistance to young people in Montgomery County,PA who are reentering the community after being incarcerated.  We use law student volunteers to work one-on-one with reentering youth to help them make an educational plan and fulfill their educational goals.

What We Are Doing

We aim to give voice to the otherwise silenced experiences of young people and families involved in the juvenile justice system.  Because Montgomery County, PA has been identified as having a disproportionate amount of minority youth being involved in the juvenile system, and because there are very few agencies focused on supporting Montgomery County, youth in reentering the community, we have chosen to focus our initial attention there.

Even working with a small group of students could have a major impact societally.  The average cost of incarcerating a juvenile for a year is about $88k per year; educating that same student is one eighth that cost.  

Our law student volunteers will work one on one with the reentering youth to help them learn their educational rights, develop a personalized and appropriate education plan, and finally reenroll in school when they return home from their juvenile detention placements.

Why We Need You

We are launching a fundraising campaign to raise $10,000, which will cover our first year's programming costs including training our mentors, educational programs for our youth, and know your rights campaigns for the community. 

All donations are tax deductible.

story:
ICE TRUCK-IT CHALLENGE

Hello,
   I'm Kris Rasley.  Since my video is what probably brought you to this crowdfunded charity page, I'll try to keep this as short and sweet as possible.  After the amazing responses that I've received from my Ice Truck-it Challenge video, I thought a lot about how I can make a lasting change....a life saving change for people who need our help.  As you are aware, I took a creative approach to the ice bucket challenge and I challenged facebook users to use their like as a means to raise a dollar of my money towards three amazing charities.  With your likes and shares, my 24 hour challenge created almost 1,000 likes in just 24 hours which resulted in my donation of $1000.00 of my own money.
   After having gone viral, I was so moved by everyone's kind words, generosity and amazing stories that i decided to triple my donation so that each charity could recieve a check of $1000.00 EACH.
  I'd love to match every like and share but I'm by no means rich, I'm just a middle class American who is trying to make some lasting positive change in this world and hopefully help to save someones life through awareness of these causes and the wonderful charities below that save lifes EVERY day.
  With great passion, I urge you to give what you can.  Every Dollar, Euro and small donation make a difference.  The initial goal is 10,000 dollars and I will be splitting this fund up between the Siteman Cancer Center, Preferred Family Healthcare and ALS (St. Louis, Mo. Chapter).  Links to each site are below.  I can't thank all of you enough for touching my life and helping to provide awareness and healing where hurt used to exist.  Please join me in trying to save someone's life who is in need.  My heart reaches out to you with warmth and blessings.
Siteman Cancer Center - http://www.siteman.wustl.edu/
-My mother passed away last February from cancer/tumors in her lungs, liver and bones.  With a wonderful spirit and an unmatched selflessness, my mother lived her life of giving without being diagnosed until two months prior to her passing.  While I am overwhelmed by her strength, I can't help but think how her life could have been saved by the wonderfull people at Siteman.  It is my hope that this fund will carry on her legacy of giving and provide early detection and treatment for someone that may not have had an opportunity.
Preferred Family Healthcare - https://pfh.org/
-Preferred Family Healthcare is a healthcare company that specialized in adult and adolescent drug and alcohol rehabilitation among other mental and behavioral health services.  Over 2 years ago, my life and the lifes of my family were rocked to the core with the death of my amazing nephew Tyler.  He was only 19 and fell victim to a lethally mixed cut of heroin.  No parent should ever have to bury their child.  No sibling or family member should have to say their goodbyes after only 19 years.  Drugs like heroin and many other drug related addictions can take hold of and kill so fast that families are sometimes left without ever even recognizing the problem existed.  It's my hope that our funds, our efforts, our awareness can help lead just one child to early awareness and treatment.  Just to know there's hope and others out there who are just like them and have made a positive turn in their lives.  Preferred Family Healthcare can give that hope to someone with our help!
-ALS (St. Louis Chapter) - http://webstl.alsa.org/site/PageServer?pagename=STL_homepage
 If it weren't for the ice bucket challenge campaign going viral, my video would have never been made, my voice never heard and my heart never able to fully heal.  ALS is a viciously debilitating disease that very little is known about.  I challenge you to go to their site, become aware of the early signs and make sure that people can get treatment as soon as possible.  While I don't have anyone close to me who has been affected by this, it breaks my heart to see and hear the stories of those who have.   Please give for them.! 
In closing, regardless of your donation amount or if you chose not to at all, please keep those affected by these causes in your heart and in your prayers.  Life is too short already to have it ripped away by the three causes I mentioned above.  God bless you for your warmth, care and generosity.  In honor of my late mother Sue and my nephew Tyler, I'd like us to prove that we can make a difference to those who need us most!

story:
The Cyclone Roller Coaster

 What Is It? 

     The Cyclone is a block based (LEGO® , Kre-o, Mega Bloks, etc.) roller coaster construction toy. It will be the first commercially available kit that combines the versatility of the world's leading building block system with the realism and excitement of the CoasterDynamix track system. The result is an amazing roller coaster model that is easy to build and fun to customize. Join multiple sets together to make larger, more elaborate custom designs.The possibilities are endless! 

What Do You Get?

     The Cyclone kit comes with over 1000 individual pieces and has everything needed to build a 4' long working roller coaster model. This includes standard and custom bricks, lift chain, gears, hand crank, track, and a train. With the provided instructions, the kit is easy and fun to build with no need for extra pieces or complicated tools.

Why Pledge?

     We have put hundreds of hours into the design and engineering of the Cyclone. We need your support to make the dream of creating a block based roller coaster system a reality. That support will enable us to purchase the plastic injection molds needed to make all the components, as well as building inventory for production. With our experience in bringing exciting roller coaster models to market, coupled with your support, we feel the Cyclone can be a tremendous success.

 

     

This project was conceived by a dedicated group of engineers, including a real roller coaster designer. Based around the CoasterDynamix track and train system developed in 2004, the Cyclone functions just like an actual roller coaster. A miniature chain lift hauls the cars to the top of the first hill, then gravity takes over from there. The kit includes everything you need to build the Cyclone.

 

 

LEGO® is a trademark of the LEGO® Group of companies which does not sponsor, authorize or endorse this project.

Use your imagination to build the coaster of your dreams! This eight-foot long racing model was built by combining four Cyclone kits.
 
The Cyclone model comes with a hand crank for the chain lift, but also has a direct fit for the Lego® Power Functions (#8882) and battery box (#8881), available for purchase separately.

story:
Please Visit Our Homepage To Learn More 

Our Values and Mission

Key Elements Group is a consulting firm with over 50+ years collective experience working in the nonprofit sector. From raising scholarships for local community colleges to organizing major donor campaigns for world-class fine arts organizations, Key Elements Group helps others make a difference through our innovative fundraising strategies and techniques. 

Our guiding principle is to help nonprofits and innovators formulate campaigns that are simple, impactful, and - perhaps most importantly - fun. With so many brilliant minds chasing their dreams and enacting their vision for a better world, it's paramount that we generate a platform to broaden the reach of our fundraising skills, enabling fresh ideas to take root and taking our partners' work to the next level. 

We're ready for this step. We're ready to help even more people make a bigger difference.

Our Innovative Online Fundraising Services

In order to expand our reach, Key Elements Group has formulated an easy, cost-effective method for nonprofits and startups around the country to take advantage of our services. 

Our improved website will offer subscription-based memberships to new nonprofits just getting off the ground as well as established groups looking to get ahead. This model will enable us to not only keep our costs down, but will also greatly increase the scope and reach of our services. Our partners will have direct access to our tried-and-proven fundraising skills, at a significantly lower rate than freelance specialists charge.

Our Impact

We've helped nonprofits struggling to meet their goals exceed even their highest expectations. We've connected with entrepreneurs bristling with creative energy, and helped them channel their passion into reality.

We have funded media start-ups and community colleges, fine arts organizations and social justice groups. Now, we're ready to help more people make a greater impact.

Our improved website will multiply our already extensive list of successes, enriching the world with a greater number of effective, well-structured, and fully-funded nonprofits eager to get to work.

Our Next Step

In order for us to make our vision a reality, we need your help. With enough support, we can implement our accessible platform for the benefit of millions of nonprofits around the country. 

Please join us in making this innovative service a reality. Once we've met our goal and established our platform, we'll be able to get to work immediately helping others make a difference.

In order to expand our reach, Key Elements Group has formulated an easy, cost-effective method for nonprofits and startups around the country to take advantage of our services. 


Our improved website will offer subscription-based memberships to new nonprofits just getting off the ground as well as established groups looking to get ahead. This model will enable us to not only keep our costs down, but will also greatly increase the scope and reach of our services. Our partners will have direct access to our tried-and-proven fundraising skills, at a significantly lower rate than freelance specialists charge.   

Our Impact 
We've helped nonprofits struggling to meet their goals exceed even their highest expectations. We've connected with entrepreneurs bristling with creative energy, and helped them channel their passion into reality.
We have funded media start-ups and community colleges, fine arts organizations and social justice groups. Now, we're ready to help more people make a greater impact.


Our improved website will multiply our already extensive list of successes, enriching the world with a greater number of effective, well-structured, and fully-funded nonprofits eager to get to work.   

Our Next Step  
In order for us to make our vision a reality, we need your help. With enough support, we can implement our accessible platform for the benefit of millions of nonprofits around the country. 


Please join us in making this innovative service a reality. Once we've met our goal and established our platform, we'll be able to get to work immediately helping others make a difference.

story:
How it Started: Beginning to Blossom
     My name is Jenessa, and I am a recent college graduate looking to leave my hometown in Upstate New York to learn how to sustainably and organically grow food at the University of Vermont's Farmer Training Program.

     There are many things I have experienced in the last few fears that have sparked my passion for working in sustainable food systems and enrolling in this program. I have always considered myself to be environmentally friendly and conscious of how I and others impact the earth. I started paying attention to the kind of food I was eating, began volunteering at a local nonprofit that teaches urban and sustainable food-growing practices, and, for a paper in one of my last classes as an English major, researched the social, economic, and environmental impacts of our current industrial food system. 
      Having not known what I wanted to do once I graduated this past December (only that I wanted to in some way work to help the environment and other people), everything I was doing and learning about finally came together and pointed me toward taking this leap of faith and journeying to Burlington to embark on what I hope will be a fulfilling and rewarding experience.
      I envision a food system that, little by little, will turn more local and sustainable, nurturing communities to strengthen their relationships with where and how their food was grown, and also how to prepare it. I am so excited to be a part of this program where I will be able to learn from like-minded people who share my passions. 

The Program
-A 6-month [May-October, 2015], hands-on program for aspiring farmers and food systems advocates
-Provides an experiential, skill-based education in sustainable farming
-Students get a unique and comprehensive education by running all aspects of the 10-acre Catamount Educational Farm, learning from expert farmers and educators in the classroom and by working alongside successful, inspiring farmers in the Burlington area

Where Will This Experience Take Me?
In some ways, I see this farming program helping me with a personal discovery of my own, but more importantly I know it will also allow me to share with others what I learn by eventually using my skills to provide local communities with fresh, healthful, responsibly grown food. It is my hope that the farmer training will lead me on a career path in  small-scale organic agriculture. I am particularly interested in urban agriculture and vertical farming, and I would love to use the skills I acquire at the program to find a job in either of those fields!

How Your Donation Will Help
  • Funding the cost of the remaining $5,800 tuition for the program
  • Helping me pay for housing to live in Burlington, Vermont while I am in the program
Thank you for viewing my campaign! Any donation is helpful and much appreciated.

story:
Introducing DeFancy

WEARABLE SELF-DEFENSE

Every one of us has a variety of defenses for protection…
the automatic locks that are engaged while driving,
car and house alarms,
apps that transmits Our location to our loved ones (some even with a message and a picture). all great products.
but only one can effect your immediate security!
Law enforcement isn’t always there, and sometimes you are all alone…
so if you aren’t a top notch martial artist,
you better have DeFacny

What is Defancy?

Defancy was born from the notion that we all deserve to get home safely and feel secure anywhere, at all times. Pepper spray, ever growing in popularity, has already become a must-have for any teen and adult who care about their own well being.

Defancy, the latest state-of-the-art development in the field, redefines your real-time ability to protect those you care about the most.

Defancy’s spraying mechanism is unique to our products and engineered to spray a small amount of very strong substance for seconds. With the right usage, you can defend yourselves from up to three attackers with only one container.

Defancy offers significant advantages over other products in its category:

  1. Accessibility. It’s convenient to carry and easy to use, making sure you are protected from any human or animal attacker 24/7.
  2. Aesthetics. It’s a beautiful product which lets you look good and keep safe at the same time.
  3. Efficiency. Despite its small size, Defancy allows for 5-7 clicks before running out.
  4. Ease of use. All of our products use a push-push mechanism for separating the spray container from its base. That means you’re always just one click away from protection.


Defancy was designed with careful consideration as to the most efficient and convenient way to use it with one hand, so your other hand remains free.


Our innovation –Defancy offers several special features:

·  A Compact and stylish way to wear your self-defense device – no more need to choose between safety and fashion

·  Unique gel additive for accuracy, range and effectiveness.

·  Ultra-violet coloring marks the attacker and help law officer apprehend the offender.

·  A practice container for safely mastering the system.  

Once you’ve sprayed an attacker using Defancy, the full impact lasts for at least 45 minutes.

IMPORTANT: A one-second CLICK is enough to get the pepper spray’s full effect and incapacitate the attacker!


View of the inside of a spray container

Any attacker will feel Defancy’s effects immediately

Effects include:

·  Burning sensation on the skin

·  Temporary blindness

·  Searing cough

·  Watery eyes,

·  Excessive mucus

·  Difficulty in breathing.

*Defancy does not cause any permanent injury. The product is neither toxic nor flammable.

Defancy is 100% safe to use and does not cause permanent damage. In includes a safety mechanism for any accidental use.

With the purchase of any of our products you receive three types of sprays:

1.  A pressurized gas container which can either be used for one long spray (five seconds) or for five short sprays (one second). It can spray up to 1.4 meter away.

2.  A spraying fluid container, which can be used seven times, requiring seven separate clicks. Can spray up to 1.2 meter away.

3.  A practice container to help you learn how to operate the product and get used to it. It comes with an extra container filled with air and a neutral fluid which can be refilled again and again until you feel confident and comfortable with Defancy.

*Once you’re done practicing, send the practice container back to us to be refilled with pepper spray at no charge (apart from delivery costs).


Pepper spray, always works, on everyone.

The main advantage of pepper spray is its effectiveness it is in comparison to other similar products, such as tear gas, whose ability is reduced and even non-existent in some cases – for instance against drug addicts, people under the influence of alcohol or sedatives and some animals.

Pepper spray is extremely easy to use and intuitive. It’s made from oleoresin capsicum (which is why you might know it as OC spray), a lachrymatory agent.

About the pepper spray we use

Defancy is your personal defense against human or animal attacks.

Defancy is a one-of-a-kind formula created by the best minds in the field. Our pepper spray contains over 3 million SHU (Scoville Heat Units), providing an extremely high burn intensity.

Every Defancy product has the highest concentration of pepper spray permitted by law in your country. We manufacture a variety of items with different levels of active ingredient concentration in order to comply with most countries’ standards.

Defancy contains Gel for stickiness - the pepper spray sticks to the attacker’s face so that pepper must be washed off.

Using Gel helps make your shot more accurate and significantly lowers the effect of wind on the material’s dispersion.

The additive gel’s weight helps to increase the spray’s mass, which means we can minimize the material’s effect on objects that did not come in direct contact with it. (In regular pepper spray devices, at least 20% of the material sprayed can cause discomfort to other people who were in the area.

All Defancy sprays contain a special ultraviolet coloring substance, invisible to the naked eye and non-washable. The color stays on the skin for up to three days to help the authorities identify your attacker.

The size of the container was also carefully chosen. It only takes one second of spraying to neutralize a human or an animal for at least 40 minutes. Additionally, Defancy’s small size, less than 15 grams, is what lets us give you higher doses of the active ingredient, which larger containers are simply not allowed to store.

And finally, as the product is oil-based, it is highly durable to extreme weather and physical stress. Its proper function is guaranteed to work in temperatures of -4+158 Fahrenheit (-20+70 degrees Celsius). 


Two months after the funding campaign is over, a catalog will be sent to your email so that you can choose from over 40 men women and unisex designs


Trouble shooting:

If you made any mistake in choosing the type of product , or encountered any problem during usage, do not worry. After production has begun we will verify your order with you before  the final shipment, in order to guarantee your satisfaction.

Donations

 We pledge to give  10% of all  the products created with your donations to selected organizations which  will help  people in need of protection, such as victims of sexual assault, domestic violence and more.




Our products


Card holder clip

This innocent-looking piece of office-wear makes for the perfect day-to-day protection at work and around the city. It has a hidden pepper spray container that is very simple to draw out and use. The pepper spray clip is indiscernible from any other regular card holder clip - it’s easily available in case of an emergency yet will not draw any attention to it.

Size: 0.67x1.18 inch (17x30 mm), slightly larger than your regular office card holder. 

Two months after the funding campaign is over, a catalog will be sent to your email so that you can choose from over 40 men women and unisex designs 


_____________________________________________________________________________





Key chain

Sporty by design and convenient to carry around, this product can protect you wherever you go. Carry it on various items of clothing or hang it on your keychain, and only you will know its true ability.

Size: 1.96x0.55 inch (50x14 mm) with a slick and modern look - and super easy to use so you can always be prepared in case of an emergency.

_____________________________________________________________________________



Necklace and Pendant

The more elegant option. Beauty and protection all in one item.

The pepper spray is hidden inside the pendant, making it available to you at all times. The design insures that no one will be able to spot the potential as anything but a beautiful piece of jewelry… Only you will know..

Size:

Pendants 1.18x0.63 inch (30x16 mm).

Basic unisex necklace 17.71 inch (45 cm) or 25.6 inch (65 cm).

Two months after the funding campaign is over, a catalog will be sent to your email so that you can choose from over 40 men women and unisex designs 




_____________________________________________________________________________

Wristwatch add-on or iPhone sticker

Another highly convenient item is the wristwatch add-on, a small pepper spray container that comes with industry strength double-sided adhesive and is small and thin enough to fit on your watch - so you can feel safe wherever you go. The design is comfortable and will never bother your wrist. You can just as easily stick it on your iPhone, for full protection right in your pocket.

The wristwatch add-on comes in two different sizes:

1. Medium Diameter circle 1.02 Inches (26 Millimeter)

2.Large-Diameter circle 1.26 Inches (32 Millimeter)

It can fit almost all different types of watches.(Except for the small ones) When you buy this product you get three different holders,(in addition to the three spray containers ).

In case you want to switch between watches and still remain protected, you can also choose to stick one of the holders on your phone.

Note: The wristwatch add-on only fits flat watch-bases. Use a simple home ruler to make sure your watch’s base  (the part that touches your wrist ) isn’t curved. If it is, the add-on may not be able to stick to it optimally.

_____________________________________________________________________________



Ring

If jewelry is more desirable for you, take a look at Defancy’s ring. It’s a classy option that is virtually indiscernible from regular rings but still keeps you safe and secure whenever and wherever you go. Be fashionable and protected at the same time!

Rings vary in sizes (more on that in the catalog) so you can be sure you’ll find the right one for you. The platform size of the ring is 0.63x0.47 inch (16x12 mm)


Two months after the funding campaign is over, a catalog will be sent to your email so that you can choose from over 40 men women and unisex designs 






Hi, my name is Nir Neria and I’m the founder responsible for this wonderful new product.

Once, out of care for my family, I bought myself and my loved ones pepper spray cans. Buying them made me feel and think that we’re protected. Soon enough I realized that it just wasn’t enough. There were too many occasions on which we needed the cans and for various reasons did not have them by our side.


I was suddenly reminded of an incident I’d had not long ago, when I scratched my eyes shortly after cutting hot peppers. The painful results of that scratch came back to my mind. That day I promised myself to check exactly what it takes to neutralize an attacker. In addition to consulting with specialists, I decided to try it out myself. I sprayed a minuscule amount on my own face. That’s when I realized the world needs the new product which you are about to see..

We all tell our loved ones at least once a day to take care of themselves. Today, thanks to Defancy, it’s time to go beyond just saying, and give them the right tools for the task. With Defancy they can be protected 24/7. Don’t tell them to take care - give them the tools to be able to do so.

story:
OUR VISION

Village Bakery and Provisions brings to life artisan breads, pastries, and local prepared food. We exist to create authentic food that's good for your body, heart, and soul. 
(Watch the video above!)


Pastries: VB+P pastries include Austrian and French inspired pastries, cakes and tortes in a delicious southern fashion.

These baked goods are hand-crafted through timeless European baking styles.

Breads: VB+P artisan breads are made with sprouted grains and heirloom grains. Rustic. Naturally leavened. 

Prepared foods: VB+P provides a local selection of foods prepared sous-vide (French for "under vacuum"). Sous-vide is a method of cooking food sealed in airtight plastic bags in a water bath or in a temperature-controlled steam environment for longer than normal cooking times. This method cooks the food evenly, ensuring that the inside is properly cooked without overcooking the outside, while retaining moisture. It dates all the way back to the late 1700s.


OUR CHALLENGE

We are opening our store at the Nashville Farmer’s Market in May 2015. Your support helps with final equipment purchases and covering marketing costs like a shiny new website.


Help us bring more hand-crafted goodness in the world!



WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  1. Give to this campaign today. Look to the right of your screen... We’ve got a lot of sweet rewards lined up for you!
  2. Spread the word about our new spot at the Nashville Farmer’s Market!

(And then come visit us.)


Thank you so much for taking the time to see what the Village Bakery and Provisions is all about!

story:
Beth and Jenna have been friends for five years and each have massive amounts of service industry experience. There have been many nights spent on Beth's back porch discussing the idea of opening their own restaurant, what it would look like and what kind of food they would serve.  One day, Beth met up with Jenna and said "How about a Vegan Chinese food truck" and that is all it took, ticket sold!  They have been brainstorming and workshopping since then and are excited and ready for this chance to make their dream a reality.  

Their goal has been set at $15,000 because, who knew, food trucks are expensive!  Also getting good with the city of Austin takes a lot of permitting and startup costs add up quickly.  

To give you an idea of the costs your contribution will be applied to, they have compiled a list of items needed to get off the ground:

*Truck Purchase/Repair~$8,000

*Truck Wrap/Artwork~$2,500

*Commercial Stove top with 6 burners ~$1,800

*City/State permitting and Business Fees~$1,000

*Woks and cooking supplies~$700

*Service counter~$350

*Rice Steamer~$200

*Proper storage containers~$200

*Initial Pantry Stock including sustainable serving/to-go containers~$100

They are so incredibly grateful for the love and support they have already received and are really excited to tap into a market that is not well represented in the Austin vegan community.  Please help them get started by contributing anything you can, spare change, $2 bills you don't know what to do with, or jokes to keep them going.  You will be rewarded with hugs and maybe other secret gifts that are in the works. 

They will be serving fresh local veggies stir fried with your choice of sauce which includes; sesame garlic, manchurian, super spicy red pepper, and a milder sweet and spicy ginger. To take it up a notch you can pick from a variety of protein options; tempura style cauliflower, quinoa cauliflower vegballs, or tempura style soy curls. In addition they will offer a weekly special such as; char sui bao, kimchi pancakes, and who knows, maybe even chinese pizza.....the sky's the limit!! And yes, of course they will have spring rolls.

Beth & Jenna wish to express their extreme gratitude for your contributions!
story_txt: Beth and Jenna have been friends for five years and each have massive amounts of service industry experience. There have been many nights spent on Beth's back porch discussing the idea of opening their own restaurant, what it would look like and what kind of food they would serve.  One day, Beth met up with Jenna and said "How about a Vegan Chinese food truck" and that is all it took, ticket sold!  They have been brainstorming and workshopping since then and are excited and ready for this chance to make their dream a reality.  Their goal has been set at $15,000 because, who knew, food trucks are expensive!  Also getting good with the city of Austin takes a lot of permitting and startup costs add up quickly.  To give you an idea of the costs your contribution will be applied to, they have compiled a list of items needed to get off the ground:*Truck Purchase/Repair~$8,000*Truck Wrap/Artwork~$2,500*Commercial Stove top with 6 burners ~$1,800*City/State permitting and Business Fees~$1,000*Woks and cooking supplies~$700*Service counter~$350*Rice Steamer~$200*Proper storage containers~$200*Initial Pantry Stock including sustainable serving/to-go containers~$100They are so incredibly grateful for the love and support they have already received and are really excited to tap into a market that is not well represented in the Austin vegan community.  Please help them get started by contributing anything you can, spare change, $2 bills you don't know what to do with, or jokes to keep them going.  You will be rewarded with hugs and maybe other secret gifts that are in the works. They will be serving fresh local veggies stir fried with your choice of sauce which includes; sesame garlic, manchurian, super spicy red pepper, and a milder sweet and spicy ginger. To take it up a notch you can pick from a variety of protein options; tempura style cauliflower, quinoa cauliflower vegballs, or tempura style soy curls. In addition they will offer a weekly special such as; char sui bao, kimchi pancakes, and who knows, maybe even chinese pizza.....the sky's the limit!! And yes, of course they will have spring rolls.Beth & Jenna wish to express their extreme gratitude for your contributions!

story:
Ladies and Gentlemen, enter The Cabaret! The stage is yours to take…

The Vision in the Desert

You stroll around Nowhere and see a shaded space: Colorful lights, little tables, chairs… and you are invited: Come into The Drunken Sobriety Cabaret! Curious, you approach… You have a seat, you have a rest… but what is that? There are funny, artsy phones on the table, and one of them rings! You pick it up, surprised – and are invited to join the stage… Play! Improvise! Be a Shakespearean actor, be a drag queen, be a harlequin, be whatever you like… 

The Cabaret wants to promote artistic interaction and self-expression at the Nowhere festival and aims to incite everyone to play theatre, fool around, go on stage or ask others to do crazy, daring acts. 

A comfortable shade and meeting point during the day, a buzzing firework of participative fun at night – the Drunken Sobriety Cabaret invites everyone to come and express themselves. There will be opportunity to interact through the art phones, and also themed evenings, games and programmed pieces of improvisation theatre where everyone will be invited to join.

The Project


After a successful but windy first appearance at Nowhere 2014 the Cabaret is back in a modified form: The stage will receive a bigger shelter, offering shade in the afternoon for spontaneous explorations and games. With your contribution, you help us to realise our vision in a more permanent form: We want to build a new shade structure that should last and be a contribution to Nowhere also in the years to come, and we want to enhance our sound equipment.

Funds needed for:

Shadow net €350

Wood beams €80

Sound /technical equipment €350

Decoration 120€

Fees, perks €100-150

Participative Play and Creative Self-Expression

We aim for you to dare and explore your funny, emotional, giddy, sad, melodramatic… side – especially if you have never or hardly ever dared to do so on stage before. In the afternoons, there will be opportunity to explore your wild side in a cozy and intimate environment – come with your friends, explore what games we offer or bring your own, check our table phones for some outrageous assignment… play for yourself, for a friend or for passers-by. In the evenings, we will have music, games and improv-theatre to watch or to incite you to hop on stage.

Gamers, players, circus artists, drag queens, improv-theatre performers, Shakespearean actors – drunk or sober, you all are welcome to jump on our stage – get in touch with us for a spot of your own in our programme.

Changes in 2015

The Cabaret returns with the lovely Cabaret sign and stage background, as well as most of the technical equipment and lights from last year, but this time (due to the experience with wind last year) a more sheltered stage. A new, somewhat bigger shaded space will harbour our colourful little tables and chairs, with some sparkly new décor. We want to schedule more easy games that anyone can join and offer opportunity for free exploration. The Artphones will connect tables, stage and some other points at Nowhere, for more interactive fun: There will be automated assignments, but also the possibility for anyone (or secret inciting agents from afar) to call up the tables or the stage, giving or asking for instructions or artistic input or some crazy acts of daring. We will have some announced plays and themed evenings.

Team

The DSC Team is an international bunch of Burners from Southern France, Vienna (Austrian Burners Association) and other European cities. Project leads are:

* Sebastian aka “Lightning” (previous art projects at Nowhere: 2008 ORNI, 2009 rolling gardenswing, 2010-11 ARTPHONE, 2012 installation of a nest, 2013 SweetART - the candyflosswigmakingcart, Drunken Sobriety Cabaret 2014),

*Tünde aka “Thunder” (2013 The Altar of Spontaneous Baptism and Gifting, Vienna Burning Ball 2014 and 2015, Drunken Sobriety Cabaret 2014).

Other team members are Krevette, Monica, Judy, Andrea, Olivier, Corinne...

story:
Introduction

My name is Karan Sah and I am a Life Scout at Troop 425 based in Lexington SC Zion Lutheran Church. I am planning on completing my Eagle Rank in the following months. For my Eagle Scout Project, I have chosen to build a staircase and the beginning of a walkway for the pavilion near the wetlands. I have been to Saluda Shoals Park many times and I have camped there with my troop multiple times. I first came here as a child and I continue to use its resources for camping, access to the river, and other recreational activities. It would be an honor if I could give back to the park by building this staircase and the beginning of a walkway. I have experience with building and construction with wood and other outdoor material such as building numerous benches and trails. My troop also has a high variety of skills and experience which can come into use during the construction of my project. Most of the volunteers that will help me with the construction of the project will come from this pool. To lead the volunteers I plan to use the past experience I received from being a leader in the troop and other groups I was part of.

Project

The project contains a new staircase for the pavilion by the wetlands and a start of a walkway. The first part of the project would be the clearing of the area where the staircase will go. This included clearing small trees and shrubs that block the path and possibly leveling the ground a little to ensure a good build. Part of the pavilion will also have to go (right side) to make room for the staircase. We will be careful with this process taking out the planks. My design has the staircase using the already existing posts for the first posts for the staircase stringers to go through. We will then place five other posts for the stringers. There will be three stringers, so in the middle there will be three posts and at the end there will be two posts. The walkway will be in a design where the water will be available to endure water flooding. The wood that I will use for the project will be treated pinewood and the screws will be galvanized non-corrosive steel to ensure a long lifetime for both the staircase and walkway. The design will be similar to already existing staircases at the park to so there will be matching and professional- looking. The walkway will be in the simple shape of square and it will connect with the staircase.

story:
UPDATE: July 30

THANKS to donations that have arrived via the US Mail, our current total is $5569!  

PLEASE help us reach our goal...ONLY 2 more days!



CAMPaign Update:  $1410 raised as of July 6

We are only 19% of the way to our goal!! Let's finish what we started...

 


July 1 CAMPaign Update


 

We're raised $510 of $7500

We're getting close to our JULY 10 deadline and

WE NEED YOUR HELP

meeting our goal!



*******************************************************************

CAMPaign Update:  $410 raised as of June 25

Help us STAY ON TARGET toward our goal of $7500 by July 10!


DONATE TODAY

EECM Summer Camp

East End Cooperative Ministry's Summer Camp is unique because we specialize in working with at-risk urban youth.

  • We have been changing the lives of thousands of at-risk youth for 45 years teaching them skills to become active participants in life versus spectators, or worse, victims of life.  
  • Your donation will ensure that EECM Summer Camp continues to be there for these children, and their children, and their children's children as a healthy life-transforming experience that long outlasts childhood.

Help Us Raise $7500 In The Next 4 Weeks!

The cost of camp is more than 6 times what our families can pay.  Our goal is to raise $7,500 by JULY 10 so that we can continue to provide the quality Summer Camp experience that has been successfully changing lives for so many years. Your donation is needed!.  

WE NEED YOUR HELP!

A Gift For You!

DONATE $25 and receive an imprinted EECM click pen.

DONATE $50 and receive a personalized thank you letter from a child at camp.

DONATE $200 and you will be invited to attend the end of camp production on July 31, 2015 to see firsthand the amazing results of camp.

The Impact

East End Cooperative Ministry has been extraordinarily successful in improving the lives of the children we serve. Our influence is generational.  We have grandparents who went to or worked at camp, then sent their kids, and now their grandchildren are coming. The impact of Summer Camp is being passed on! Studies show that at-risk youth can develop skills of positive identity, social skills, physical and thinking skills, and positive values through an enriched, structured camp experience. In addition, camp helps at-risk kids develop resilience that can enable them to thrive in adverse environments. We teach age-appropriate lessons about being the best person that they can be, and living skillfully and strategically in an effort to:

  • lessen juvenile crime
  • reduce teen pregnancies
  • decrease substance abuse
  • eliminate child abuse/domestic violence
  • reduce school drop-outs


Risks & Challenges

There was a time in history when kids were kids, adults were adults, and roles and boundaries between the two were clear and undisputed. Today's youth culture is saturated with negative messages for and about kids. We live in a world where exposure to adult issues and experiences causes them to mature at an unhealthy rate and in an unsound fashion, and the population most affected by this are urban youth.

Urban youth are not only influenced by popular culture, but popular youth culture motivates, reinforces, and perpetuates the negative experiences and influences that these children experience everyday in their communities, in their schools, and in their homes. This generation of urban youth is developing a severe attitude of apathy. They take the stance that they will live life to the fullest, day to day, based on the belief that they may not see tomorrow, but at the same time not really having any understanding of what’s truly valuable in life. The result is that they act out this belief in unhealthy and unproductive ways.  Our job is to provide healthy, affirming, and age-appropriate activities with their peers and with adults who care, so that:

  • relationships are built
  • hearts are opened
  • kids are influenced
  • lives are changed

Other Ways You Can Help

We know you care and want to help our at-risk youth become productive and self-sufficient adults.  

  • SPREAD THE WORD and make some noise about this critical CAMPaign
  • Help get the word out; tell your friends, family and coworkers by sharing this on Facebook, Twitter and Email

Thank you for helping us meet our goal by JULY 10!

story:
Our Story

Help us grow local independent roasters!


“Our business focus is to empower local roasters and cafes but also to help consumers save money and find new stores”

We aim to unite independent coffee roasters and coffee together
and give them economic scale and tools that they cannot get by themselves,
but keeping their independent atmosphere
It’s hard to support local coffee shops, especially when the big chains seems to occupy every block in Seoul.
Therefore, we are designed to give small coffee shops a competitive advantage in an increasingly competitive marketplace.

What We Do

  • We work exclusively with Seoul’s top rated, small-batch independent roasters.
  • Unlike factory roasting, our partners source beans and roast with the greatest of care
  • We curate every coffee we offer, bringing the best of the neighborhood café into customers home.
  • We offer flexible subscription plans with  no hassles or commitments.




How It Works

  • We hand-pick gourmet coffees from Seoul’s top roasters every month
  • Coffee bean ships to customer within 48 hours of roasting to ensure peak freshness
  • We brew and enjoy discovering new favorites from world-renowned coffee roasters
  • We make it easy. Free to cancel any time. Skip months or change preference.


Use of Funds

We need your help to build the platform that will allow people around the country to order our coffee beans online. 


Funders Rewards

$100 : 1 month plan

210g of coffee beans each month(3 different kinds of beans from 3 different roasters)


$300 : 3 months plan

210g of coffee beans/month x 3(3 different kinds of beans from 3 different roasters)


$500: 6 months plan

210g of coffee beans/month x 6(3 different kinds of beans from 3 different roasters)


$1000: 1 year plan

210g of coffee beans/month x 12(3 different kinds of beans from 3 different roasters)





Why Crowdfunding

Part of the idea behind the lean startup is to prove demand, and build products in a rapid, user-centered design cycle. By reaching out on indiegogo, we can assess our demand, build a stronger relationship with our early adopters, and use feedback to make our product as amazing as possible
