story:
For your incredible support! We're thrilled to have hit our target and be able to put our plans in motion to set up an assembly line in Kenya - where many of you will be receiving your GravityLights from in 2016!

Our campaign is still open, 'in demand', to enable those that missed our campaign deadline to still support and be a part of GravityLight: Made in Africa.  

We will be keeping you posted with updates via Indiegogo on what we're up to and our progress on setting up in Kenya.

You can also follow us on twitter and Facebook too.

Thank you again!

__________________________________


GravityLight is an innovative solution that generates power from the lift of a weight.


As Featured In:


  • Instant light, any time
  • No sun or batteries needed
  • With GravityLight all you need is a weight.


Feedback from global trials of our first design, GL01, was extremely encouraging!

Vitally, it also gave us insights into what needed improving.

After extensive iterations and accelerated life testing we developed an improved model, GL02, that is:




Today, over 1 in 5 people do not have electricity. Instead, they rely on dangerous and polluting kerosene lamps for light.

GravityLight has been designed primarily as a safe, clean and affordable alternative to kerosene lamps.

Your support will enable us to launch our improved GravityLight - to help eliminate kerosene lamps - as well as to establish an assembly line in Kenya.


Hear from Evelyn what it's like to use a kerosene lamp for light:


In 2014, enabled by the Indiegogo community,  we conducted global trials with over 1300 off-grid families of our first GravityLight design – GL01. 

Over 90% of those who tried GravityLight said they would use one instead of a kerosene lamp!


Switching from kerosene to GravityLight starts a positive cycle of benefits - of money saved, increased productive hours and improved health. 

In parallel, GravityLight eliminates the carbon dioxide and black carbon that kerosene lamps emit. 





We want GravityLight to be an empowering product in every sense of the word.

As well as designing GravityLight to provide a clean, safe and affordable alternative to kerosene lamps, we also want to create local jobs, skills and livelihoods for those who make and sell GravityLights.

Although GravityLight will be available internationally, Kenya is a one of our launch markets for off-grid families. It represents a gateway to East Africa and has an emerging manufacturing industry, which we hope to help develop and grow.

Our approach is to learn from and partner with the best and we’ve found a fantastic, like-minded partner to work with in Kenya: Burn Cookstove Manufacturers.


Our goal is to raise $199,000 in 40 days!

With these funds we can set up assembly in Kenya of our new and improved GravityLight: GL02. 

Your support will fund materials, such as soldering irons, assembly jigs and quality testing equipment, as well as staff training on assembling GravityLight and performing QC and QA checks.

If you choose the ‘Made in Africa’ perks, your GravityLights will be some of the first off this new line!  If you choose 'ASAP', you will still be supporting setting up operations in Kenya but, to get your GravityLight more quickly, means it will be assembled in China.

Once you’ve chosen your reward, you can also opt to add an additional donation – which will directly support building local jobs and skills in Kenya by establishing our assembly line there. 

NB. The GravityLight Foundation is a UK registered charity, so please let us know if you are a UK tax payer to enable us to claim Gift Aid from the UK government. 

Many thanks for your support – this couldn’t happen without it!



In supporting this campaign, you’ll be an invaluable part of GravityLight’s journey. It’s not often that people are part of such formative stages in a product’s development and we’re excited to share one of the first, ‘beta’ versions of GL02 with you.

GravityLight is unique. It creates a new category of lighting: it’s not just a variation on something that already exists. This raises different challenges to an ‘off-the-shelf’ or ‘me2’ product

Product development journey:

We have spent over a year transforming a very successful design (GL01) into a game-changing product (GL02). Over the next few months we will be commissioning tooling to create the first-off samples of GL02 to test and further optimize. There may be further improvements that we identify in this process – which means that you’ll be getting an even better design, that may even look slightly different from the images shown.

Quality Control:

When we have the first few samples produced we will need to ensure these meet our quality standards. If they don't this is where iterative tweaks and improvements to the data and moulds are needed.

We have factored in several months for this process, which may involve iterative edits and improvements until we’re happy with what we’re sending you. However, if these take longer than anticipated, we’ll let you know why along with a revised timeline.

Beta GravityLights:

You’ll be receiving one of the first samples of the new GravityLight design: GL02. We will have rigorous Quality Control and Quality Assurance processes in place but there still could be a few ‘bugs’ that aren’t picked up in this testing. This is an important part of the learning process and we’d really appreciate your feedback on these.

For example, with GL01, we found a defect occurring during transit over sea, and we heard that UV light was causing some of the straps to become brittle and snap. This became valuable to integrate into our design considerations and testing for GL02.

We have done extensive ‘accelerated life testing’ of the GL02 prototype and so have worked to eliminate all the issues we identified, however you may find something new. We’ll set up a forum to hear how you use your GravityLight and your suggestions for further developments. Thank you for being part of this journey!

Setting up assembly facilities in Kenya:

We've previously set up assembly lines in China and have found a brilliant, experienced partner to set up assembly in Kenya.

For ‘Made in Africa’ perks, GravityLights will be assembled in Kenya on the new assembly line established there. We’ve factored in an additional 4 months during which components will be shipped to Kenya, the new assembly line trained and assembly kicked off, with a growing pace.

That said, if anything unexpected happens that delays this timeline, we’ll let you know why along with a revised delivery date.

Shipping your rewards:

From experience, this took several months for some GravityLights to arrive. We’ve assumed 2 months in the perk descriptions – we’ll let you know the date they ship.


Together the GravityLight team have over 60 years combined experience in product design, collaborating with different partners and bringing products to market.

From inventing a gravity-powered light to establishing assembly of these in Kenya, we aren’t ones to take well-trodden paths! Instead, we aim to maximise the positive benefits that GravityLight can bring – for those who use, create and sell them.

This is our second Indiegogo campaign for GravityLight, which means we know a lot about the challenges ahead! You’re in experienced hands.


Are you a non-profit organisation?

Yes. The GravityLight Foundation is a registered UK charity.

So if you’re a UK taxpayer, please let us know so that we can maximise your generosity and claim Gift Aid from the UK government!


How does GravityLight work?

Once GravityLight is installed and a 12kg weight – a bag of rocks or sand – attached, it’s ready to go, anytime.

The weight is lifted by pulling down on a bead cord. On release, the weight falls very slowly, transforming potential energy into kinetic energy as it powers a drive sprocket and polymer gear train.

This generates just under a tenth of a watt, to power an onboard LED and ancillary devices.

Once the weighted bag reaches the floor, which depends on how high it was installed, it is simply lifted to repeat the process.


Can it power other things?

Along with your GravityLight, you’ll also receive 2 SatLights which can be daisy- chained around the room and used as task lights.

GravityLight has a DC jack where SatLights and other devices, such as a radio, can be attached. We’d love to hear what you use your GravityLight to power with a tenth of a watt.


How long does the GravityLight work for per lift?

With GL02, it depends on how high you install your GravityLight. The winch system in GL02 means that anyone can use GravityLight, however high it is installed. A 6ft drop gives over 20 minutes of light.


In your last campaign I could ‘buy one, give one’. Can I do that again?

We chose this approach previously as we were testing the concept of GravityLight – would people use one? Would it work in different conditions and how long would it last for. There were so many unknowns to find out that we felt gifting these to our trialists in off-grid communities was the right approach.

We have worked hard to find the right balance between low cost, good quality and elegant design. Going forward, our approach is one of selling GravityLights for several reasons:

- Creating livelihoods: Working through local distribution partners and sales agents means that people can earn a living through selling GravityLights and similar products. Rather than undermining the local economy by giving away free products, we are able to create jobs and help people earn an income through GravityLight.

- Building a scalable, sustainable approach: If we gave away GravityLights to over 1.3 billion people that don’t have access to electricity, we would need to raise a lot of money! Instead, by creating a product that people value and are willing to pay for, GravityLight will be able to reach far more people, more quickly, without it’s fate being reliant on continuous fundraising. We are building a social venture that will be self-sustaining in 3 years time.

That said, you are welcome to pledge for a GravityLight – or many - and ask us to send these to someone else. Just let us know when we ask for delivery addresses where you’d like them sent.


Why Kenya?

Kenya, is one of our key ‘launch markets’ in the next 12 months. Having researched and visited several countries and potential partners, we chose it for many reasons including:

- International Trading Infrastructure:

Mombasa port, on the coast of Kenya, is a key international shipping hub. This means that it has the infrastructure to cope with international shipments from suppliers of GravityLight components.

- Access to sub-Saharan Africa

Sub-Saharan Africa is home to 800 million off-grid people and, as the grid struggles to keep pace with population growth, this number continues to rise. It is therefore an important geographical area for our work to eliminate kerosene lamps and serve off-grid communities.

Kenya, as part of the Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa, is a traditional gateway into East Africa and parts of Southern Africa. This means that, once we’ve established partnerships, approaches and routes to market that work well in Kenya, we can look to understand how these need to be tailored to expand into neighbouring countries.

- Great partners

We’ve met a range of experienced and inspiring partners, including Burn, who are based in Kenya. Many of them have operations across East Africa but Kenya is where they have their largest operations.

Achieving economies of scale is critical in helping us keep the price of GravityLight low, so we are keen to develop a successful approach in Kenya that will help keep costs down for neighbouring countries too.


I have other questions that aren't on here - where do I go?

You can send questions on the comments section of this campaign or by email to info@gravitylight.org

You may also find the answer you're looking for on our website.
story_txt:
For your incredible support! We're thrilled to have hit our target and be able to put our plans in motion to set up an assembly line in Kenya - where many of you will be receiving your GravityLights from in 2016!
Our campaign is still open, 'in demand', to enable those that missed our campaign deadline to still support and be a part of GravityLight: Made in Africa.  
We will be keeping you posted with updates via Indiegogo on what we're up to and our progress on setting up in Kenya.
You can also follow us on twitter and Facebook too.
Thank you again!
__________________________________

GravityLight is an innovative
solution that
generates power from the lift of a weight.



As Featured In:








Instant light, any time


No sun or batteries needed


With GravityLight all you need is a
weight.





Feedback from global trials of our first design, GL01, was extremely encouraging!
Vitally, it also gave us insights into what needed improving.
After extensive iterations and accelerated life testing we developed an improved model, GL02, that is:





Today, over
1 in 5 people do not have electricity. Instead, they rely on dangerous and
polluting kerosene lamps for light.
GravityLight
has been designed primarily as a safe, clean and affordable alternative to kerosene lamps.
Your
support will enable us to launch our improved GravityLight - to help eliminate kerosene lamps - as well as to establish an
assembly line in Kenya.




Hear from Evelyn what it's like to use a kerosene lamp for light:








In
2014, enabled by the Indiegogo
community,  we conducted global trials
with over 1300 off-grid families of our first GravityLight design – GL01. 
Over 90% of those who tried GravityLight
said they would use one instead of a kerosene lamp!


Switching from kerosene to GravityLight starts a positive cycle of benefits - of money saved, increased productive
hours and improved health. 

In parallel, GravityLight
eliminates the carbon dioxide and black carbon that kerosene lamps emit. 




















We want GravityLight to be an empowering
product in every sense of the word.
As well as designing GravityLight
to provide a clean, safe and affordable alternative to kerosene lamps, we also
want to
create local jobs, skills and livelihoods for
those who make and sell GravityLights.
Although GravityLight will be available
internationally, Kenya is a one of our launch markets for off-grid families. It represents
a gateway to East Africa and has an emerging manufacturing industry, which we
hope to help develop and grow.
Our approach is to learn
from and partner with the best and we’ve found a fantastic, like-minded
partner to work with in Kenya: Burn Cookstove
Manufacturers.



Our goal is to raise $199,000 in 40 days!
With these funds we can set up assembly in Kenya of our new and improved GravityLight: GL02. 
Your support will fund materials, such as soldering irons, assembly jigs and quality testing equipment, as well as staff training on assembling GravityLight and performing QC and QA checks.
If you choose the ‘Made in Africa’ perks, your GravityLights will be some of the first off this new line!  If you choose 'ASAP', you will still be supporting setting up operations in Kenya but, to get your GravityLight more quickly, means it will be assembled in China.
Once you’ve chosen your reward, you can also opt to add an additional donation – which will directly support building local jobs and skills in Kenya by establishing our assembly line there. 
NB. The GravityLight Foundation is a UK registered charity, so please let us know if you are a UK tax payer to enable us to claim Gift Aid from the UK government. 
Many thanks for your support – this couldn’t happen without it!

story:
DramaWay is the leading provider of fine arts programming in the Greater Toronto Area for people of all abilities, specializing in modifying programming for individuals with special needs. 

  • Danielle Strnad founded DramaWay in 1999 the company has grown to offer programs throughout the Greater Toronto Area to more then 300 participants of varying abilities 
  • This campaign will provide continued pride in the performance space we can offer to our actors and performers  
  • Contributors will be giving our clients with special needs an amazing opportunity, one that they will cherish for their whole lives. Giving our performers a sense of accomplishment and self worth is absolutely priceless!

What We Need & What You Get

  • DramaWay needs $5,000 to rent beautiful and professional theatre spaces as well as cover many additional costs associated with our productions
  • DramaWay is prepared to release amazing and fun perks straight from our memorable clients
  • If we do not reach our goal the funds raised through Indiegogo will still go towards the cost of the theatre rental and showcase expenses. Anything helps!

The Impact

  • It goes without saying that the impact these professional theatre spaces have on our production and performers is invaluable. The evolution of our programs has steadily grown but being able to perform and have our participants experience professional pride stands to be incomparable!

Risks & Challenges

Although we pride our company in it's growth it seems we cannot maintain the level of what we have begun to offer with rising costs and the need of many expert facilitators to pull off these productions. The reality is so much planning, effort, time and money are allocated to these productions and their sheer size that we cannot continue if we don't have help. 

  • With the help of this campaigns success DramaWay can fully pay for the rental of our theatre space and cover some of the many production expenses. This will free up nearly a quarter of our budget to other areas in dire need of monetary support
  • Further to this campaign DramaWay is taking a whole new approach to our production. We will be re-imagining many costume pieces and sets to provide an amazing production without a major unnecessary cost

Other Ways You Can Help

  • DramaWay is always accepting volunteers for our production. This can be for our front of house, or weekly programming behind the scenes
  • Please visit our website at www.dramaway.com to find more volunteer information, or contact our direct Danielle Strnad through her email at dramawayoffice@gmail.com if you're interested in becoming a volunteer!
  • Please remember to use the sharing tools that Indiegogo offers! Getting the word out about our campaign is nearly as great as donating! We could always use the help and vote of confidence!

We thank you for your attention to this awesome cause. Together we truly can make a difference.

story:
Hello,

My name is Casey Rozanski and I am currently an intern at The Alma Center, a non-profit, located in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.  At our program we teach classes targeted at making men better partners, fathers and citizens.  We are a community based organization with a mission of peaceful change.  We currently have at any time up to twelve residents staying at our facility.  These men have alot of doctors appointments, they go job hunting, enjoy group activities. etc.  This is made very difficult for us without a van and staff members have to use there personal cars to take men on their errands.  Often times we have to have two staff members away from the center taking men places and then we have to have at least one staff member stay behind to assist the men at the Alma Center.

This just makes things very complicated and costs us more money because we have to have more people on staff.  Having a van would make our lives so much easier and enrich the men's lives as well.  With a van we would have more opportunities for group activities like fishing and hiking as well. 

As an intern I have been with the Alma Center for seven months and I have about two more months until I graduate with my Masters in Social Work.  I have made it my personal fight and mission to get this organization a van because I know that there is a true need for it.  And if anyone deserves this gift it is the staff at The Alma Center who give their all to make this community and the men we serve and their families.  Please help if you can and rest assured that your donation will make a difference in many lives.

story:
PLEASE CHECK OUT THE "UPDATES" SECTION!!!!  

 

 

the picture up is the picture I took on the phone and sent to my email one of the first days we started living in our car.. it's a picture of my husband and cat looking out the window before we get ready to call it a day and take a nap..it was a bad day :/

Hi everyone I'm chosing to keep  my name annonymous, if that's okay.

I'm a married teenager with a cat.. we're living in my husbands car and it's honestly been a struggle for us.. we move from walmart parking lot to the next.

ã€€

Our cat has her own space in the backseat with her litterbox and food/water set up.

 ATTENTION:

we take very good care of our cat.. on "good days"

we put her harnest on and let her run around a local park.

(we feel she needs to get out as much as possible and stretch her legs)

My husband has a landscaping job... he doesn't make much at all though. We live off his paycheck but have nothing left over.

His paycheck pays for all of the listed.

  • Cat food and cat litter
  • Food for us to eat
  • Gas
  • We buy one day gym passes just to use the showers
  • Laundry Mat to wash our clothes

The list goes on...

 and we never have enough to put aside to try to get a place of our own..

While my husband is at work, I take care of our cat, sometimes if we're parked next to stores I'll walk around and window shop. I'll get fresh air or take a run.. the other day I was surfing the net and found a video of kids teasing a bus driver.. it broke my heart.. I was crying with her. Me and my husband have such little money but I donated $5.00 anyways.. I felt God means it when he says.. if you give.. you'll recieve more.. so I'm hoping that'll happen.

I wasn't going to make a page because I don't like begging and I'm honestly embarassed and ashamed of our situation but I thought I'd leave it in God's hands and see if this works out..

I'm trying to raise money so me and my husband can get an apartment of our own.. I'm hoping we can have enough raised to put a down payment and pay off a couple months.. I'm not sure as to where we want to find a place but the searching will begin if we get the money raised..

I'd also like to buy a bed, some furniture... just things we need... we are not in the position to buy stuff we "want" .. not yet that is.

Please find it in your heart to help us out.

ã€€

the trunk is our closet.. it's where we keep all our clothes..

the backseat is where we keep our other things and it's also where my cats stuff is and where she sleeps. It's very important me and my husband get out and stretch because us sleeping seperate in our car seats are killing our backs. :(

Our Story:

we both come from very small families...

both of them were against our marriage.. my family stopped speaking to me because I married him and his family told him they'd never accept me..

so we chose to move away..

we both had a lot of money saved because we had good jobs.. but we quit to move to San Antonio, Texas... where we found a room to rent out.. with a woman who posted she had a room available on craigslist. We lived with her for 5 months.

but she told us we had 10 days to leave because she was having her sister move in.. she felt very badly but we didn't want to be a bother so we packed up and left.

we have no one but each other and everyday we are praying for a miracle.

MY HUSBAND DOES NOT KNOW ABOUT THIS

He's at work right now and I'm supposed to pick him up in in 2 hours. it's 7PM right now on 6/21/12

I want to do this not only for us but mainly for him.

He has done nothing but love me.. he tries so hard to bring home money and he tries so hard to take care of me.. I know he's struggling and I know he's depressed.. I wish I could be the one with the job..

the one taking care of him but he'd never let that happen..

unless it was through a website like this and he didn't know!

His birthday is in July. He will be 19 years old and I know I could turn both our lives around if I do this and earn money for us...

My plan:

Is to earn money so that on his birthday, I can surprise him by dressing up really pretty.. taking him out for fancy sushi and telling him everything I did.. then showing him the amount in our bank account.. and telling him that we are looking for an apartment as soon as possible.. then getting to go to the store and getting a little furniture..

his heart would smile if it could... I can see it now. That is my dream to make my husband proud. He deserves this... working till early morning to late night.. not coming home to a home cooked mean but instead leftovers from a cheap fastfood place.. then having to sleep in a car seat that can't even go all the way back.. it breaks my heart.. it makes me feel like he should have never married me, instead listened to his family so he could at least sleep in a warm bed.

I know if I can make this happen for both of us...

 he'll be proud of me.. that's all I long for.

ã€€

What we go through:

We have to buy CHEAP food at fast food places, everyday.

We buy daily gym passes to take showers. $10 each.. and my husband gets one everyday because he works in hard labor and needs one /:

If we don't have money for it, we go to a car wash and use the sink to wash up in.

We use A LOT of gas because we're constantly looking for a new job for him..

We park outside hotels and starbucks to get internet ..like i'm doing now.

we have had to pawn everything valuable to us.. his xbox 360, our good laptop, we kept the crappy one.. lots of games and dvds.. we're down to the bone when it comes to having our nice stuff being sold.. we even had to pawn his wedding ring but we got it back when we pawned other stuff and used half his paycheck..

I don't want people feeling sorry for us.

I know we're EVEN LUCKY TO HAVE A CAR to sleep in. I know we're lucky to have money for FOOD. God blessed us with that.. but like I said,

I want to surprise my husband and make him proud.

 I know his heart would fill with joy if I got to do this for him.
story_txt:
PLEASE CHECK OUT THE "UPDATES" SECTION!!!!   
 
 
the picture up is the picture I took on the phone and sent to my email one of the first days we started living in our car.. it's a picture of my husband and cat looking out the window before we get ready to call it a day and take a nap..it was a bad day :/
Hi everyone I'm chosing to keep  my name annonymous, if that's okay.
I'm a married teenager with a cat.. we're living in my husbands car and it's honestly been a struggle for us.. we move from walmart parking lot to the next.
ã€€
Our cat has her own space in the backseat with her litterbox and food/water set up.
 ATTENTION:
we take very good care of our cat.. on "good days"
we put her harnest on and let her run around a local park.
(we feel she needs to get out as much as possible and stretch her legs)
My husband has a landscaping job... he doesn't make much at all though. We live off his paycheck but have nothing left over.
His paycheck pays for all of the listed.

Cat food and cat litter
Food for us to eat
Gas
We buy one day gym passes just to use the showers
Laundry Mat to wash our clothes
The list goes on...
 and we never have enough to put aside to try to get a place of our own..
While my husband is at work, I take care of our cat, sometimes if we're parked next to stores I'll walk around and window shop. I'll get fresh air or take a run.. the other day I was surfing the net and found a video of kids teasing a bus driver.. it broke my heart.. I was crying with her. Me and my husband have such little money but I donated $5.00 anyways.. I felt God means it when he says.. if you give.. you'll recieve more.. so I'm hoping that'll happen.
I wasn't going to make a page because I don't like begging and I'm honestly embarassed and ashamed of our situation but I thought I'd leave it in God's hands and see if this works out..
I'm trying to raise money so me and my husband can get an apartment of our own.. I'm hoping we can have enough raised to put a down payment and pay off a couple months.. I'm not sure as to where we want to find a place but the searching will begin if we get the money raised..
I'd also like to buy a bed, some furniture... just things we need... we are not in the position to buy stuff we "want" .. not yet that is.
Please find it in your heart to help us out.
ã€€
the trunk is our closet.. it's where we keep all our clothes..
the backseat is where we keep our other things and it's also where my cats stuff is and where she sleeps. It's very important me and my husband get out and stretch because us sleeping seperate in our car seats are killing our backs. :(
Our Story:
we both come from very small families...
both of them were against our marriage.. my family stopped speaking to me because I married him and his family told him they'd never accept me..
so we chose to move away..
we both had a lot of money saved because we had good jobs.. but we quit to move to San Antonio, Texas... where we found a room to rent out.. with a woman who posted she had a room available on craigslist. We lived with her for 5 months.
but she told us we had 10 days to leave because she was having her sister move in.. she felt very badly but we didn't want to be a bother so we packed up and left.
we have no one but each other and everyday we are praying for a miracle.
MY HUSBAND DOES NOT KNOW ABOUT THIS
He's at work right now and I'm supposed to pick him up in in 2 hours. it's 7PM right now on 6/21/12
I want to do this not only for us but mainly for him.
He has done nothing but love me.. he tries so hard to bring home money and he tries so hard to take care of me.. I know he's struggling and I know he's depressed.. I wish I could be the one with the job..
the one taking care of him but he'd never let that happen..
unless it was through a website like this and he didn't know!
His birthday is in July. He will be 19 years old and I know I could turn both our lives around if I do this and earn money for us...
My plan:
Is to earn money so that on his birthday, I can surprise him by dressing up really pretty.. taking him out for fancy sushi and telling him everything I did.. then showing him the amount in our bank account.. and telling him that we are looking for an apartment as soon as possible.. then getting to go to the store and getting a little furniture..
his heart would smile if it could... I can see it now. That is my dream to make my husband proud. He deserves this... working till early morning to late night.. not coming home to a home cooked mean but instead leftovers from a cheap fastfood place.. then having to sleep in a car seat that can't even go all the way back.. it breaks my heart.. it makes me feel like he should have never married me, instead listened to his family so he could at least sleep in a warm bed.
I know if I can make this happen for both of us...
 he'll be proud of me.. that's all I long for.
ã€€
What we go through:
We have to buy CHEAP food at fast food places, everyday.
We buy daily gym passes to take showers. $10 each.. and my husband gets one everyday because he works in hard labor and needs one /:
If we don't have money for it, we go to a car wash and use the sink to wash up in.
We use A LOT of gas because we're constantly looking for a new job for him..
We park outside hotels and starbucks to get internet ..like i'm doing now.
we have had to pawn everything valuable to us.. his xbox 360, our good laptop, we kept the crappy one.. lots of games and dvds.. we're down to the bone when it comes to having our nice stuff being sold.. we even had to pawn his wedding ring but we got it back when we pawned other stuff and used half his paycheck..
I don't want people feeling sorry for us.
I know we're EVEN LUCKY TO HAVE A CAR to sleep in. I know we're lucky to have money for FOOD. God blessed us with that.. but like I said,
I want to surprise my husband and make him proud.
 I know his heart would fill with joy if I got to do this for him.

story:
Short Summary

There is such an enormous amount of information about food available to the general public that it would be impossible to summarise or discuss its significance in one book. Instead we have put together a book that looks at contemporary food issues starting with how modern food is produced/manufactured, then discussing what we should be eating and why we are eating it and ending with what the food does to us once we have consumed it.

Each Chapter has been written by an expert in the subject and topics include the origins and progress of scientifically moderated food, how some germs that we eat will keep us healthy, whereas others will kill us, the origins of food allergy, what we should be feeding our children and how our emotions control our eating habits.
 
This book has been published on amazon using the kindle platform

Click here for UK Amazon site

Click here for US Amazon site

 
We now need funds to promote the book, so that we reach a wider audience.  This is the first phase of funding.  The second phase will be to publish a hard copy to make the book more widely available
 

 Quotes from the book authors

  1. “The number of overweight people on earth has for the first time exceeded the number of hungry people”
    Professor Denis Murphy
  2. “In terms of cell numbers, we are only 10% human and 90% bacteria!”
    Dr Sampo Lahtinen
  3. “In the beginning… we are born hungry, hungry for love, hungry for food”
    Ayse Banbridge and Sonia Di Gennaro
  4. “Obesity itself is a form of malnourishment”
    Jo Smith, School Meals Development Officer
  5. “Campylobacter is the major cause of bacterial gastroenteritis food poisoning worldwide”
    Dr Christopher Gooding

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5000 to increase our marketing and reach a wide audience for this book.

For your contribution you will get an e-copy of the book and/or a mention on the books web site

The Impact

What we are aiming to do is help people take a moment out of their day to give some thought for the food they are eating. Your contribution will help us reach a wider audience

Other Ways You Can Help

You could also contribute to our Thought for food networks

http://thoughtforfoodbook.com/

https://www.facebook.com/Thought4Food

story:
Project Summary

We love planes, we love to fly. But there is a problem - we have to buy or to build aircraft.

There are different solutions and technologies to create a model plane - fiberglass, balsa, foam and its various combinations. All available technologies have their benefits and disadvantages.

Fiberglass hulls looks smooth and is rugged, but it is fragile and its building is very time-consuming. This technology also is not cheap - price for good airliner begins from thousand usd.

Manufacturing by using balsa and foam is cheap enough. It gives a very lightweight hulls, but it is very fragile and requires much effort to give a good looking surface.

I suggest another technology for building aircraft hull structures - petg plastic. This way of building allow to make aircraft as cheap as foam but with the fiberglass's quality and strength. Hull surface looks perfectly and resilient enough to easily stand the minor bumps and impacts.

Precalculated shells weight of 1:40 scale aircraft (wingspan 58 inch, length 61 inch) is a slightly above 1200 grams

 What We Need & What You Get

We have already made wooden forms, some samples to test technology and we have placed a pre-order for the production of ten samples.

Wood design is not sufficiently durable to ensure mass production - moulds has to be made of aluminium alloy.

Whole set of alloy mold will cost above 20 thousand of usd.

In addition, to reduce the cost of production of the need to purchase a molding machine and wholesale purchase of a large number of plastic (several tonns).

Vacuum forming machine for production needs cost about 15 thousand.

The remainder of funding will be spend for the purchase of petg plastic, consumables, workshop rental, logistics services, packing development.

As an incentive for your help, we offer you future products at prime cost.

Your help can create a new industry, it's not necessary to dabble in the small competitive pool when there is an empty ocean of possibilities!

What else could be done

Aside from supporting us financially – we are ready to communicate with interested persons. We are always open to dialogue and discussion and we would appreciate your assistance in improving our product.

story:
Short Summary

Tropical Storm Debby flooded the neighborhood of Calloway in Lake City, FL on June 25, 2012. My friends, the White family, have had their home ruined by flooding. Please keep in mind that their neighborhood was not classified as a flood zone.

This donations page is for friends and family to lend a helping hand so that they can move back into their home as soon as possible. Donations from the good people of the internet would be greatly appreciated,not expected.

The estimated cost of repairs is upwards of 20,000 dollars. I'm hoping to raise enough to ease the financial burden that they will have to endure.

story:
Short Summary

I'm Mel and I run Just A Little Black Card, LLC (JALBC), a matchmaking and dating consultation company in Chicago. My passion is people (particularly — people falling in love!) When I started this company, I worked on find the "secret sauce" (my matchmaking algorithm) to making relationships/matches work. Now I have and I need to build out this software so I can turn this amazing job into a scalable business.

Every single dollar you donate will go directly into building/designing the software (which we've already had quoted) and the maintenance and support associated with it. Any excess will go towards advertising and continuing to help me build out our client base.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking for $13,800. Nope - looking for $8,300!

$5,500 will go towards software development. UPDATE - we've raised this amount from OFFLINE funding so even though it's officially done, we can't update the goal amount on IndieGoGo, per their rules.

$5,000 will go towards the front-end design of the software.

$1,500 will go towards the maintenance and hosting for 1 year.

$552-1,170 (or 4%-9% of the fundraising goal) will go to IndieGoGo fees.

Remaining (depending on how many rewards are claimed) will go to reward fulfillment.

The Impact

If you know me personally, than you already know how much this business means to me and any donation amount will be appreciated. I've bootstrapped this business from the very beginning and I'm downsizing my personal life (didn't sell my Beanie Babies but I did sell a lot of other things and I did really move out of my flat!) — I absolutely love being an entrepreneur and making this happen is a dream right now!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please spread the word. Maybe you have a single friend desperately in need for a profile rewrite or someone who needs dating advice. 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jalbc

Twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/melmelcarammel

story:
WHAT IF A POOR ETHIOPIAN FAMILY HAD OPPORTUNITY TO HELP THEMSELVES?

WHAT IF THEY COULD HELP THEIR NEIGHBOURS??

 

THE GETAHUN PROJECT

This story begins in a small town, an important historical site in north/central Ethiopia.  After  visiting Lalibela as a younger-aged backpacker, I discovered a depth of poverty unlike anything seen before.  The experience helped initiate an eventual decision to become a sponsor, for one of the area’s poorest families.

By retirement, and realizing a different arrangement was needed, the following plan emerged.  I would finance construction of a small guest-house, to replace the sponsorship.  In hopes it could in time develop into more, than just a small business. That it would create resources, develop sustainability, and transfer this to the community.  With both the agreement, and cooperation of the family.

 

 

It takes everybody to get at the roots of poverty:

Our plan was for the empowering family to assist whatever way they could, the surrounding community’s serious, most essential needs.  With the added factor of a connected gardening plot, to help produce what was necessary, pass some of the benefit directly to least accessible, or those having unequal supports. A solution designed to improve overall living conditions. The local municipality provided lists of needs, the project could comply.

 

Situated just inside the northern town of Lalibela, THE GETAHUN PROJECT would have the potential to generate an adequate income, in addition to a suitable shelter, with a ready agricultural base. Lalibela being an important centre having strong monasterial, and historical roots.  A fact that overlooks a permeating poverty exhibited not only in the town, but the whole environs.

 

Here is what has been done to date:

A basic, 14-room structure, with attached gardening section.  Agricultural production was started, and is ongoing.

About 80 local people were hired, providing a living wage, between 2010 and 2011. Structural interior has been finished to rough form only. Wiring and waterlines were completed.

Validity of Project can be confirmed through the following documents

Proof of Funding 

Mayor's Endorsement

 

 

Immediate Objectives

  • TO DEVELOP A SEPTIC SYSTEM
  • COMPLETE INTERIOR FINISHING – INCLUDING DOORS, WINDOWS, SOME ROOFING.
  • QUANTITIES OF ARABLE SOIL TO BE HAULED TO SITE (SOIL IS ROCKY AND THIN) FOR MODIFICATION, EXPANSION, AND AGRICULTURE EXPERIMENTATION
  • LABOUR COSTS EXPECTATIONS
  • ESTIMATED COST ASSESSMENT, IN AMERICAN DOLLARS -- $35,000

 

The following are the  project plans, ear-marked for the community, and area:

 

  • To improve life situation of orphanage members, and unattached seniors, now lacking supports, that would include clothing and shoes for orphanage children, as well as children of poor families
  • Grain-grinder machine targeted, for at least one rural village. Others will be targeted in the future, as funding becomes available. Farmers gain opportunity to grind their grain and seed-crops, freeing up time for farming activities. Crops are currently hauled via tough landscapes, entirely by foot, or by both foot and donkey, to an in-town grinder
  • Procuring of pharmaceuticals, designated diarrhea and ulcer medications, that have chronic shortages, urgently needed for people eating or drinking sparingly, wrongly, and sometimes not at all. 
  • Assessment of water resources at village level, where unclean water is an ongoing issue. While this represents a main cause of diarrhea and stomach ulcers in out-lying villages where river water is used, it is also a recurring problem in Lalibela itself, and continually threatens lives
  • Most rural settlements struggle with poor night lighting. The Getahun Project hopes to supply  compact lighting units, to deter villagers lighting fires by night, thereby decreasing ill effects of smoke inhalation.
  • Getahun Project intends to assist remote farmer children in education possibilities

 

Sustainability:

Project goals are to be linked with receipts from the guesthouse, monastery tours, and possible restaurant and other tourist-related activities, connected with the guesthouse.

Annual income creates job opportunities in both the guesthouse, and agricultural operations.

 

REWARDS OR GIFTS (PERKS)--IN THE EVENT OF CONTRIBUTIONS  --

 

THE GETAHUN PROJECT began a search operation some time ago, with the result being an accumulation of well selected articles chosen with worth, collectability, and variety in mind.  Most articles were gathered from locations throughout North Wollo and Lalibela vicinity, or nearby monasteries.  Some originated from more remote locations.  All articles are produced by competent craftsmen, are either new, or considerably older, with suitable values.  Those considered older are quite often of higher quality.  Articles are to be chosen randomly from each stock-pile, and by order of contribution, until stock runs out.  They are ready for shipment, from a Canadian location.

Gifts of $25 or more will be accompanied by two secret (Getahun) family recipes, with particular spice combinations unique to Lalibela area.  Recipes are mailed exactly as written. 

In lieu of money contributions, used clothing and shoes in various children's sizes, are extremely welcoming, as clothing in most adult sizes.  Lalibela is situated in the cool highlands, where warm clothing is appreciated.  Parcels can be sent c/o Abebe Getahun Family Project, Box 210, Lalibela, Ethiopia

Updated information with progress reports involving future building activities, in addition to our community efforts, will be posted on a website. Construction costs to be included, if project recommences.

 

Conclusion,  Historical Background:

Ethiopia’s central highland culture, commonly-believed Syriac-Nestorian in origin, is primarily Amhara ethnic-centred. Often expressed by inherent gentleness, and robust pride in a rich, but difficult history, and rudimentary, way of life.  Modern Amharic, a cross of Semitic and other Asian language streams, melded into an indigenous language, creating the ethnic tongue. ‘Bet Amhara’ (Amhara home) as it is sometimes referred, is the uniquely inspiring, highland region.

The following deserves repeating as a major incentive of our project from the outset.  A sometimes mentioned fact that “ ETHIOPIA STILL HAS THE SECOND LARGEST POOR POPULATION IN AFRICA, AND IS THE SECOND POOREST COUNTRY IN THE WORLD (ACCORDING TO CURRENT 'HUMAN DEVELOPMENT MULTIDIMENTIONAL POVERTY INDEX') WHERE 90% OF THE POPULATION LIVE BELOW THE  POVERTY LINE, AND MANY PEOPLE CONTINUE TO DIE OF EXTREME POVERTY, AND HUNGER". TO THIS, WE COULD ADD THAT A THIRD STILL SUBSIST ON UNDER A DOLLAR A DAY!

‘FORBES LIST’ PLACES ETHIOPIA— FOURTH ‘SADDEST’ NATION, ON EARTH

 

ANY CONTRIBUTION, MONETARY, OR BY RELAYED MESSAGES OF OUR PROJECT VIA INTERNET OR WORD OF MOUTH, IS MOST  APPRECIATED.   

 

  

THE GETAHUNS ARE ASSURED THIS FAMILY/COMMUNITY-DIRECTED AGREEMENT WILL BE USEFUL IN SUPPORTING SOME OF LALIBELA’S MOST VULNERABLE.  OUR PROJECT FULLY COMMITS TO THIS RESPONSIBILITY

 

 

REGARDS……………………………RAYMOND DOUCETTE

Annual income creates job opportunities in both the guesthouse, and agricultural operations.
 
REWARDS OR GIFTS (PERKS)--IN THE EVENT OF CONTRIBUTIONS  --
 
THE GETAHUN PROJECT began a search operation some time ago, with the result being an accumulation of well selected articles chosen with worth, collectability, and variety in mind.  Most articles were gathered from locations throughout North Wollo and Lalibela vicinity, or nearby monasteries.  Some originated from more remote locations.  All articles are produced by competent craftsmen, are either new, or considerably older, with suitable values.  Those considered older are quite often of higher quality.  Articles are to be chosen randomly from each stock-pile, and by order of contribution, until stock runs out.  They are ready for shipment, from a Canadian location.
Gifts of $25 or more will be accompanied by two secret (Getahun) family recipes, with particular spice combinations unique to Lalibela area.  Recipes are mailed exactly as written. 
In lieu of money contributions, used clothing and shoes in various children's sizes, are extremely welcoming, as clothing in most adult sizes.  Lalibela is situated in the cool highlands, where warm clothing is appreciated.  Parcels can be sent c/o Abebe Getahun Family Project, Box 210, Lalibela, Ethiopia
Updated information with progress reports involving future building activities, in addition to our community efforts, will be posted on a website. Construction costs to be included, if project recommences.
 
Conclusion,  Historical Background:
Ethiopia’s central highland culture, commonly-believed Syriac-Nestorian in origin, is primarily Amhara ethnic-centred. Often expressed by inherent gentleness, and robust pride in a rich, but difficult history, and rudimentary, way of life.  Modern Amharic, a cross of Semitic and other Asian language streams, melded into an indigenous language, creating the ethnic tongue. ‘Bet Amhara’ (Amhara home) as it is sometimes referred, is the uniquely inspiring, highland region.
The following deserves repeating as a major incentive of our project from the outset.  A sometimes mentioned fact that “ ETHIOPIA STILL HAS THE SECOND LARGEST POOR POPULATION IN AFRICA, AND IS THE SECOND POOREST COUNTRY IN THE WORLD (ACCORDING TO CURRENT 'HUMAN DEVELOPMENT MULTIDIMENTIONAL POVERTY INDEX') WHERE 90% OF THE POPULATION LIVE BELOW THE  POVERTY LINE, AND MANY PEOPLE CONTINUE TO DIE OF EXTREME POVERTY, AND HUNGER". TO THIS, WE COULD ADD THAT A THIRD STILL SUBSIST ON UNDER A DOLLAR A DAY!
‘FORBES LIST’ PLACES ETHIOPIA— FOURTH ‘SADDEST’ NATION, ON EARTH
 
ANY CONTRIBUTION, MONETARY, OR BY RELAYED MESSAGES OF OUR PROJECT VIA INTERNET OR WORD OF MOUTH, IS MOST  APPRECIATED.   
 
  
THE GETAHUNS ARE ASSURED THIS FAMILY/COMMUNITY-DIRECTED AGREEMENT WILL BE USEFUL IN SUPPORTING SOME OF LALIBELA’S MOST VULNERABLE.  OUR PROJECT FULLY COMMITS TO THIS RESPONSIBILITY
 
 
REGARDS……………………………RAYMOND DOUCETTE

story:
FOLKS! HELP US OUT! $500 is the MINIMUM we need!! Support Queer and Trans* Artists of Color and QTPOC community building! Yeah!

FCQ! (For Colored Queers) is a community based Queer and Transgendered People of Color (QTPOC)-centered project. Currently, FCQ! consists of a blog where we hope to publish QTPOC work that is socially and politically relevant to our diverse communities, through addressing social, racial, gendered, economic, and Queer justice. Additionally, FCQ! is producing a performance series featuring QTPOC artists, addressing various themes as well as creating space for facilitated dialogue around those themes. The first evening of performance is set for March 2, 2013, and is focused on issues of Colonization and Survival. We recognize the paucity of QTPOC-centered spaces, and aim for FCQ! to play a role in filling a need within our communities, by becoming a tool for social and creative justice, radical healing and politics, and genuine community building.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $500.00 to cover expenses for renting a space and equipment to make this first event happen. Given that we are otherwise doing this out of pocket, having a starting budget will take a load off our backs as far as getting this project started.
 
Ideally, we'd love to raise $1000 or more to be able to pay the artists a stipend as well. Raising this money before the show would allow ticket sales to go towards the next FCQ! event, therefore creating a more sustainable cycle of moneyflow for the project.
 
What you get:

For $10: mention in program

For $25: mention in program and personalized art-postcard mailed to you by FCQ! members

For $50: the above plus FCQ mini-poster with original design by FCQ! members mailed to you

For $75: all of the above plus mention in program and FCQ mini-poster with original design by FCQ! members, and hard copy of Panda Army’s upcoming ep

For $100: all of the above and FCQ! T-shirt

For $200: all of the above plus personal photo shoot with Heidi Andrea Restrepo Rhodes including digital copies of your portraits, and 3 8x10 + 3 5x7 printed hard copies of images of your choice

For $200: All of the awards for the $10-$100 levels, plus a hand-made wallet. You choose your favorite comic strip and Thao P. Nguyen will build you an a wallet using paper and packing tape. Trust me, you will LOVE it and your friends will be so jealous. Such celebrities as W. Kamau Bell (from the FX hit show Totally Biased) are proud owners of Thao's custom-made wallets.

The Impact

Queer and Trans* People of Color need more spaces that are centered on our needs, our healing, justice in our communities. We need more spaces where our voices can be heard, where our politics can rail, where our love can glow. By investing in intellectual, creative, and literary art, as well as anti-oppression-based dialogue, by QTPOC, for QTPOC, we are reinforcing the fact that our communities matter, that we are talented and powerful and should be heard, and that social change begins in small but meaningful ways that change us and our worlds.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We recognize that not everybody can contribute financially. and we appreciate your support in so many forms! If you would like to help in other ways, please check out the following ideas!

Help get the word out about FCQ!, our fundraiser, our webpages, etc! Use the Indiegogo share tools, share on facebook, twitter, and other social media!

Keep an eye out for ticket sales to begin soon, and pass the word on!

If you can donate materials, photocopy access, color printer access, or other things like this, please contact heidiarhodes@gmail.com

 

Thank you!

story:
Sunday Night (Feb 5th, 2012) Leah and Tracy's Apartment burned down. They have lost all their material posessions. This is a campain to hopefully help them get back on their feet and replace some of what has been lost. All money collected will go directly to the girls to replace their belongings.

 

More information on the story here:

http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/story/2012/02/06/edmonton-fort-mcmurray-apartment-fire.html

story:
Summary

The disAbility News Reporter was created to give people with disabilities a voice and a professional news outlet. Our mission is to report current events within the context of the disability community. Our goal is to inform readers, both with and without disabilities, about how events and public policies impact the lives of people with disabilities and their families. We will cover a wide range of topics and fields to help our readers gain deeper insight into the disability community from the perspectives of those within it. Almost all of our writers are individuals with disabilities who have lived and worked within the community.  

Description of Campaign

In recent years the disability community has severely suffered under the weight of the American economic recession. However, many of its impacts are going unreported. For the disability community and its leaders to prosper, the disability community and those that wish to help out must have access to consistent news and an understanding of the issues that are impacting the community. By having access to disability news, discussions can take place, solutions can start to take form and actions can create better outcomes for the disability community. The positive social impact of disability news can be measured in terms of more employment opportunities, greater access to higher education, an increase in affordable and accessible housing, greater political involvement, and new ideas to solving problems.

Capital Goal

Our goal is to raise $55k by next year (but $15k by the end of this year) to fund our news operations. Currently, we are an unfunded initiative without paid staff. We function through in-kind donations from staff and guest writers. Your contributions will allow us to: 

  • Maintain and upgrade our website ($2k);
  • Upgrade our computer equipment (1 used laptop at $500) and software ( Dreamweaver CS6- web design packet at $500);
  • Open and sign a two-year lease for physical office space (one or two office rooms at $9k);
  • Hire one full-time staff member (writer) to contribute weekly news ($31k);
  • Hire one part-time staff member (administrative staff at $7k);
  • Buy subscription to Constant Contact (internet marketing tool at $200);
  • Pay for the incorporated of the disAbility News Reporter ($800 State fee);
  • Hire internet marketing consultants to help promote the website ($1.5k);
  • Pay for professional writing development workshops ($500);
  • Sponsor two contests (writing news contest and a disability news comedy video contest ) to promote the website ($1k);
  • Purchased used office furniture ($500); and
  • Two years of utilities ($500).

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us. Join our mailing list, follow us on Youtube, Twitter, Facebook, and use Indiegogo share tools.
  • Tell others about us. We think it is great that people, with and without disabilities, visit our website and read our news. Access to news from disability community members is a unique and interesting point of view that fosters positive social action and leads to a better community.
  • Offer free services or materials. In-kind and pro-bono support is need and appreciated. We will be taking advantage of many of the free services and low-cost workshops offered at the local Small Business Association. If you are Chicago-based internet marketing consultants we would love to meet with you. Please send us an email.      

About Our Founder

Jose Mendez is the founder of disAbility News Reporter. He has extensive work experience in the workforce development field with emphases on serving people with disabilities and low-income individuals, as well as other employment barriers. He has worked at several disability community and governmental organizations, including Access Living and the Mayor's Office of People with Disabilities in Chicago. Jose has also served on a number of disability-related boards and committees, such as the Illinois Statewide Independent Living Centers Council, the Mayor's Special Education Task Force, and the Committee for the Integration of Latinos with Disabilities. He has a Master’s Degree in Special Education from the University of Illinois at Chicago and was born with cerebral palsy.

• Promote healing and growth in Sherman Park by creating an inclusive and healthy community space
  • Restore an important main street to a vibrant commercial center that offers restaurants, services and cultural opportunities for families
  • Strengthen entrepreneurship by supporting diverse small business owners and providing mentorship and support
  • Create 45+ jobs that provide opportunities for residents and young people to gain work experience
  • Provide inclusive pathways to community wealth and opportunities for neighbors to directly invest in the project

 

Imagining the phoenix that can rise from these ashes.  

Join us - visualize possibility!

story:
This is Rafael Barrit.

He is a happy and charismatic boy who readily gives compliments and more readily professes his love to people he meets where ever he goes.  Rafael is mentally retarded and he is my son.

Rafael also has epilepsy, ADHD & Autism. 

This combination of conditions has a mortality rate over 10 times greater than normal when first diagnosed.  Because of his ADHD, Rafael has a great need for stimulus and he has discovered a method to self-induce a seizure to satisfy this need.  If left to his own devices, Rafael will attempt to self-induce a seizure every 10 minutes.

Rafael seeks to experience the "aura" of a seizure and then tries to stop the seizure before he loses control.  An "aura" can be described as very powerful and unique sensations that precursor a seizure.  Auras are unique to each individual depending on the parts of the brain affected by the epileptic trigger.  Rafael does not understand that this action is very dangerous--fortunately his medication inhibits the rapid firing of neurons that leads to a full seizure, so generally a loss of control manifests as soiled pants.

Rafael has been medicated since he was 2 years old.  A doctor specializing in child behavior suggested that Rafael's brain may rely on these powerful drugs instead of regulating its own chemistry. These drugs also damage his liver.  To prevent further harm we try to give Rafael only the minimum dose he needs to control his epilepsy.  We feel it is only a matter of time before his medications can no longer prevent an induced seizure from running its full course because of insufficient dosage or tolerance.  Rafael requires constant care and constant supervision.

There is a chance he may "outgrow" childhood epilepsy as he enters puberty and the increase of hormones changes his brain chemistry.  9 of 10 children with absence epilepsy have a 50% chance of having zero seizures after reaching 20 years of age. This statistic is based on the the frequency of experiencing a seizure.  Those children who were seizure free for two years (controlled by medication) were found to be most likely to leave epilepsy behind.  Unless Rafael can control his urge to self-induce, his chance to outgrow epilepsy won't improve.


On January 13th Rafael will be 9 years old

Rafael has the approximate mental capacity of a 4 year old.  Children with mental retardation usually progress at a steady rate until they are around 16 years old and remain at that mental age their entire lives.  At the current rate, Rafael will be peak at a mental age of 8.  That is not enough to live independently.

For the past 8 years, we have used the occasion of Rafael's birthday to collect food for needy families in our community.  This year we turn to the community to help Rafael.

We wish to establish a Special Needs Trust that will support Rafael when he is an adult. 

We hope that by starting this trust early, we will be able to grow this fund enough to cover all his needs including the possibility of treatments not covered by insurance. While Rafael is likely to receive benefits, there is still a risk of him being ruled ineligible without the protection of a trust.


About Me

I work long hours in front of a computer screen and sometimes I "get in the zone" and get massive amount of work done quickly.  It is just as pro athletes describe:  the world slows down but my movements get faster, everything seems bigger, closer and louder, & complex tasks seem easier.  Often after leaving "the zone", I feel exhausted and have painful headaches.  Sometimes I would be unable to leave "the zone" and the sensory overload would bring me to tears and force me to retreat to a dark and quiet place.

I was actually having complex partial seizures that affected how my brain interpreted my senses as well as spacial and temporal awareness.  When Rafael had his first seizure I immediately embarked on becoming an expert on all things epilepsy.  I discovered that I also have epilepsy (and so does my dad). 

All my life I used my epilepsy as a tool and I my son is doing the same.  Rafael found a way to cope with ADHD but doesn't understand the risks.  My hope is to find an alternative stimuli to eliminate this risk and give Rafael a chance to outgrow epilepsy.

story:
We are group of qualified young people, challenging our environment, education, and reality. We believe that knowledge drives behavior, and if we want to rise with our nations, we should actively participate in disseminating knowledge and sharing it, from our region, our perspective and our criticism. 

That is our difference; we are designers and we touch the problems, as part of the community, we are looking for ways to have a better quality of life. As we are joining the profession, we are searching on how to serve this cause better. For the mission we have in learning, we are striving for a competitive educational horizon. We value your time and we know it is two-way interaction. We try to explore our problems, possible ideas, solutions and actions with you.



This campaign is about awareness, the power of collective consciousness... the collective awareness. We believe our only way to change for better is through all of us. Collaboration is crucial and it is very tricky. The concept is about understanding the responsibilities of designers and the impacts that design can have on our everyday life. It is where everyone comprehensively understands, communicates, and recognizes the integration of design into our community.


We target three main audiences with one objective; awareness. The community to be aware of what they should be expecting from a design and how it affects our life, the professional work to be criticized, analyzed, and compared to avant-grade designers, and the education system to offer the students better insights on how to respond to their future responsibilities.


ArchTist is a free online platform. We will be releasing a monthly e-magazine through our website www.archtist.net and we need your contributions for:

- Team building and development workshops to deliver professional articles, reviews, and criticism

- developing an interactive platform; that's to have channels that enable you to shed lights on the most pressing issues relating design to our realities -from your point of view-, provoking discussions and stimulating solutions. In addition to having a responsive content to your preferences.

- developing a mobile application

- Setting up a workspace for ArchTist team


Join and support us to be part of the change. Help us in expanding and developing our platform, to share knowledge and affect the collective consciousness.

Another way of support can be by contributing 1$ or 500$, it is making a difference. It makes a difference when you believe in our cause and get involved in it. If you cannot contribute directly, you can share our campaign with your circle of acquaintance, you can support us by visiting our website, reading our editions, and inviting your friends to know about ArchTist and support it.

We will be sustaining our free service ,building on your contributions,  from third parties sales through a package of offers ranging from sponsorship, events, ads space, and space for job adverts. 

We are working to be the designated channel for design awareness issues, where our clients would be those trying to reach intellectual, design' aware, knowledgeable and social responsible audience and supporters. Simply, they are clients trying to reach you, or trying to recruit people like you!

story:
Short Summary

I am Sandra Mannaravalappil a Personal Chef in Charlotte NC, grew up in a family were food and family were the things we treasured most. I was in the auto industry and then Real Estate for 40 years, but my true passion was cooking. I was always the person who cooked the holiday, baked the cake and fed the sick. I grew up cooking Italian then married an Indian and add that to my collection, I now cook almost every cuisine there is and love teaching little ones to love Thai or get excited for tuna tacos or even Brussels Sprouts.

I have been cooking for families for three years now, everything from scratch, no repacked, no chemicals and in the summer I grow as much of the veggies & herbs as possible. I prepare casseroles for those under the weather, provide meal services for people recovering from illness, meals for elderly that live alone and working families that would rather eat real food then take out.

I have a demand to expand my business but cannot as I am limited to the amount of people I can cook for in their homes, commissary kitchens are limited and expensive. I met a local Baker at a fundraiser for The Union County Literacy Council, we are the perfect match to share a store front. However to meet health code here in NC it is very expensive to equip a kitchen to make this a possibility. To get up and running the up fit for a kitchen is $25,000, plus Start up and rental fees.

I understand what people go through not being able to cook dinner for their children, grabbing take out that is expensive and unhealthy. Rushing to get a meal cooked can take away all the time that is meant to spent around the table talking about your day. You will be helping me to reach my dream of keeping fresh healthy food to regular people who need help. I will be able to add delivery for those that are too old or sickly to pick up a meal. I may be able to stop one child from getting diabetes or one older person from living on cereal, helping a mother with a new baby and two other kids get to take a shower and still feed her family. 

What We Need & What You Get

The money will go towards the kitchen up fit in NC you need a very expensive Ventilation system in your kitchen which is about 7500.00 I can get a used one for 4000.00 but it still needs installation.

I need specific Sinks, Refrigeration Units, A Commercial Range, Display Cases, Oven and Installation  which if new would be 15,000.00 but I can get them used for 5000.00. and of course the installation fees. The Baker and I can pay our rent and expenses as we both already have existing clients , this is more of an expansion then a start up. We both have great products and loyal followers, just not the funds we need to take it to another level 

My unique Perks, well if you are in my area you can come and get a meal as a Thank you or some wonderful Cupcakes from the baker 

If we don't reach our goal all the money will be put into equipment to get this moving, any help is better then no help and we are ready to go. We both have all the working equipment we need , just not the kitchen set up.

The Impact 

  • Our project is valuable to us all, it shows us all that one person can make a difference. I feed people, I help to make them well, I help to keep them living under their own roof. I give them a sense of safety. I work with chemo patient and provide safe diets for them, I help families bond over dinner , I see joy in peoples faces about eating home made food. With this kitchen I will be able to deliver meals to people just like flowers or cookie baskets. I can bring your Mother Chicken Soup when she is sick, even if you live in New York. You can be a part of that 
  • I have been a successful Personal Chef for the past three years and have proven my business can survive and expand. I have a strong background in Sales and Business.
  • I can provide letters from clients, local Senators , Magazine Stories , TV Appearances  & News Paper Articles & Cookbook I have been included in. My most valuable possessions are the thank you cards from my clients that live in other states & countries, thanking me for helping them take care of a sick relative, helping them share a holiday meal with a family member or their grandchild having their first roasted Brussel Sprout

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. If I can get 15,000 people to give me one dollar I am good to go
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short SummaryI am Sandra Mannaravalappil a Personal Chef in Charlotte NC, grew up in a family were food and family were the things we treasured most. I was in the auto industry and then Real Estate for 40 years, but my true passion was cooking. I was always the person who cooked the holiday, baked the cake and fed the sick. I grew up cooking Italian then married an Indian and add that to my collection, I now cook almost every cuisine there is and love teaching little ones to love Thai or get excited for tuna tacos or even Brussels Sprouts.I have been cooking for families for three years now, everything from scratch, no repacked, no chemicals and in the summer I grow as much of the veggies & herbs as possible. I prepare casseroles for those under the weather, provide meal services for people recovering from illness, meals for elderly that live alone and working families that would rather eat real food then take out.I have a demand to expand my business but cannot as I am limited to the amount of people I can cook for in their homes, commissary kitchens are limited and expensive. I met a local Baker at a fundraiser for The Union County Literacy Council, we are the perfect match to share a store front. However to meet health code here in NC it is very expensive to equip a kitchen to make this a possibility. To get up and running the up fit for a kitchen is $25,000, plus Start up and rental fees.I understand what people go through not being able to cook dinner for their children, grabbing take out that is expensive and unhealthy. Rushing to get a meal cooked can take away all the time that is meant to spent around the table talking about your day. You will be helping me to reach my dream of keeping fresh healthy food to regular people who need help. I will be able to add delivery for those that are too old or sickly to pick up a meal. I may be able to stop one child from getting diabetes or one older person from living on cereal, helping a mother with a new baby and two other kids get to take a shower and still feed her family. What We Need & What You GetThe money will go towards the kitchen up fit in NC you need a very expensive Ventilation system in your kitchen which is about 7500.00 I can get a used one for 4000.00 but it still needs installation.I need specific Sinks, Refrigeration Units, A Commercial Range, Display Cases, Oven and Installation  which if new would be 15,000.00 but I can get them used for 5000.00. and of course the installation fees. The Baker and I can pay our rent and expenses as we both already have existing clients , this is more of an expansion then a start up. We both have great products and loyal followers, just not the funds we need to take it to another level My unique Perks, well if you are in my area you can come and get a meal as a Thank you or some wonderful Cupcakes from the baker If we don't reach our goal all the money will be put into equipment to get this moving, any help is better then no help and we are ready to go. We both have all the working equipment we need , just not the kitchen set up.The Impact 
Our project is valuable to us all, it shows us all that one person can make a difference. I feed people, I help to make them well, I help to keep them living under their own roof. I give them a sense of safety. I work with chemo patient and provide safe diets for them, I help families bond over dinner , I see joy in peoples faces about eating home made food. With this kitchen I will be able to deliver meals to people just like flowers or cookie baskets. I can bring your Mother Chicken Soup when she is sick, even if you live in New York. You can be a part of that 
I have been a successful Personal Chef for the past three years and have proven my business can survive and expand. I have a strong background in Sales and Business.
I can provide letters from clients, local Senators , Magazine Stories , TV Appearances  & News Paper Articles & Cookbook I have been included in. My most valuable possessions are the thank you cards from my clients that live in other states & countries, thanking me for helping them take care of a sick relative, helping them share a holiday meal with a family member or their grandchild having their first roasted Brussel Sprout
Other Ways You Can Help 
Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. If I can get 15,000 people to give me one dollar I am good to go
use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Your favorite neighborhood video store needs you help! The staff of Four Star (Nick, Helen, Lewis, Matt and Andy) are trying to buy the store from the current owner and become a cooperative. Unfortunately, none of us have enough money to buy the store outright. That's where you come in! We need to raise funds immediately so we can renegotiate our lease at the end of April. We operate at a solid profit, but, after thirteen years of dedication, the current owner is ready to move on to other things. If you want this Madison cultural landmark to stick around, start breaking open those piggy banks!

What We Need & What You Get

We need around $50,000 for our initial investment. In addition to the store becoming a worker cooperative, we will redouble our efforts to get even more of the movies you want! We also have a lot of cool store memorabilia and prizes, like mugs, t-shirts, the potential to get your name up in the store or even on a rental case! We are also committed to welcoming the community into the store with events and community outreach.

The Impact

Madison's best video store will remain open for you to get every movie your heart desires. We all get to keep working at a place we really believe in. We will be a co-operative which means that we will be in total control and will listen to what you want!

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell EVERYONE you know to contribute! The more people who are involved the better.

Update 4/10/14: Just to address a common concern we've been hearing, the reason we chose flexible funding for this campaign is so we would have some funds to negotiate with even if we didn't reach our $50,000 goal. If we are unable to reach an arrangement with the current owner to keep the store open, then we will refund all donations to the best of our ability. Please be sure to include an email address or other contact information with your donation.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Bobby and the Martins are my parents.  They retired from ministry a couple of years ago as they both suffer health issues.  Dad is a diabetic suffering from renal failure and has dialysis three days a week.  Mom suffers from congestive heart failure.

They have been living with me while recovering and trying to get their health back.  They are now well enough to go back home but their home is in need of major repair.  Storms damaged the roof which caused water damage inside as well.  They could not afford home insurance as they are both on fixed incomes.  Both are in wheel chairs and need a wheel chair accessible bath and shower. 

It is important for their morale that they move back home.  The elderly crave their independence, and with home health they can live out their final days in their own home if we can make it happen.  Any help would be greatly appreciated as I try to give my parents the dignity they deserve.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what they need:

$8000 to replace the roof

$5000 for handicap accessible shower

$2000 for drywall repair of water damage

$5000 for septic system repair

Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

If this works, I would like to try to raise money for other Senior Citizens who would love their independence and need repairs or retrofits to their homes.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar helps, but if you can't give please help us get the word out.
