story:
UPDATE vom 28.08.2014: Wir zeigen Euch wie Euer Profil auf der Seite aussehen wird!!!!! Siehe auch Abschnitt Darstellung.

Kurzbeschreibung

UPDATE vom 29.08.2014: Wir haben die Perks überarbeitet und noch mehr #suff Vorteile eingebaut! Siehe auch Abschnitt Pakete. Jetzt unterstützen!

Kurzbeschreibung

„Startups für Fortuna“ (#SUFF) unterstützt den 3. Ligisten Fortuna Köln durch Bandenwerbung und weitere Sponsoring-Aktivitäten. SUFF ermöglicht Startups, Unternehmen & Fans den Einstieg in die Welt des Sponsorings. Wer hat nicht mal daran gedacht irgendwann in die Fußstapfen von Abramowitsch & Co zu treten. Auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de können die Förderer sich selbst und ihre Projekte präsentieren und/oder gemeinsam im Stadion networken.

Worum geht es bei Startups für Fortuna?

„Startups für Fortuna“ ist ein Zusammenschluss fußballaffiner Kölner Jungunternehmer, ambitionierter Einzelpersonen und Fans, die Fortuna Köln in der Saison 2014/2015 durch Sponsoring und ihre Anwesenheit im Südstadion unterstützen wollen. Zu jedem Heimspiel treffen sich die Förderer von „Startups für Fortuna“ in einem festgelegten Stadionbereich treffen, erkennen einander am SUFF-Button und haben so die Möglichkeit gemeinsam 19mal im Jahr - Kölsch trinkend - zu jubeln, zu trauern und ganz nebenbei neue Ideen zu entwerfen. Hierzu ist jedes SUFF-Mitglied (Spende ab 5€) herzlich eingeladenen. Die Höhe der Spende spielt bei den Community-Treffen vor Ort im Stadion keine Rolle. Entsprechend der Spendenhöhe erhält jeder Förderer sein eigenes Profil auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de. Die Initiatoren von „Startups für Fortuna“ arbeiten zu 100 Prozent ehrenamtlich.

Was sind die Ziele und wer die Zielgruppe?

Finanzielle Unterstützung von Fortuna Köln und Aufbau eines fußballaffinen Netzwerks Kölner Startups, Jungunternehmer und Fans, die sich gemeinsam auf der Seite www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de präsentieren.

Warum sollte man Startups für Fortuna unterstützen?

VISIONÄR SEIN: Teilnehmer von „Startups für Fortuna“ betreten Neuland im deutschen Profi-Fußball. Dass sich Jungunternehmer einer Stadt zusammenschließen, um den zweiten Verein am Platz finanziell im Namen einer ehrenamtlichen „Dachorganisation“ zu unterstützen, das gibt es so in Deutschland noch nicht.

MÄZEN SEIN: Wer hat nicht schon mal darüber nachgedacht in der Haut von Roman Abramowitch, Dietmar Hopp oder eines ambitionierten Scheichs zu stecken und auf den Platz herunterzuschauen und seine Mannschaft spielen zu sehen. „Startups für Fortuna“ bietet einen kostensensiblen Einstieg ins Fußball-Sponsoring.

PRÄSENZ: Jeder Förderer von „Startups für Fortuna“ erhält ein der Größe seiner Spende entsprechendes Profil auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de. Außerdem winken weitere Vorteile, wie Sponsoring-Pakete, Freikarten, Medienpräsenz, bis hin zu Meet&Greetz mit Spielern und Testimonials. Außerdem kann jeder, sowohl vor Ort als auch im TV, voller Stolz die eigene Stadionbande und weitere Aktionen begutachten.

IDENTIFIKATION: Köln ist eine Stadt mit der man sich identifizieren muss. Ob Karneval, Dom oder - für einige - der Club aus Müngersdorf. Für einige aber auch nicht. Zum Beispiel für die, die jahrelang, auch in schlechten Zeiten, Fortuna Köln die Treue gehalten haben. Und was ist mit all denjenigen, die noch keinen eigenen Verein haben, aber nicht auf Geißböcke stehen. Und was ist mit all den Neu-Kölnern deren Herz für den Heimatverein schlägt? All die lädt „Startups für Fortuna“ ein sich zu engagieren und mit Fortuna zu identifzieren.

EHRENAMT: Die Initiatoren von „Startups für Fortuna“ arbeiten ehrenamtlich.

NETZWERKEN: Wenn sich Samstag für Samstag junge visionäre Unternehmer beim Kölsch zum Fußball gucken treffen, dann entstehen u.a. solche Ideen wie „Startups für Fortuna“. Wer weiß was noch für Ideen entstehen?

AB IN DIE CROWD-CLOUD: Weil es nichts Besseres gibt, als mit anderen Startup-Kollegen biertrinkend Fußball zu gucken und im Anschluss zu networken oder ggfs. noch weiter zu ziehen.

Folgende Pakete bieten wir an

RESERVIST (5 €): Startups für Fortuna braucht Dich, denn Du bist allzeit bereit, das Team zu verstärken. Dein #Suff Vorteil:

  • Sticker
  • Dein Name im Stadion

KEEPER (10€): Du bist eine sichere Bank und gleichzeitig der Garant für unseren Erfolg. Dein #Suff Vorteil:

  • Sticker
  • Button
  • Dein Name im Stadion

AUßENVERTEIDIGER (25€):Du marschierst die Linie unermüdlich auf und ab und sorgst für die perfekte Bananenflanke ins Sturmzentrum. Dein #Suff Vorteil:

  • Dein Name auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de
  • Sticker
  • Button

INNENVERTEIDIGER (50€):Gegen Dich bekommen die gegnerischen Stürmer keinen Stich und Deine Ausflüge in den gegnerischen 16er lehren jedem Gegner das Fürchten. Dein #Suff Vorteil:

  • Dein Name auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de mit Link zu einer Website Deiner Wahl
  • Social Post mit allen Innenverteidigern
  • Sticker & Button

SECHSER (100€, 25 Pakete): Du sorgst für Stabilität und Struktur im Spielaufbau und drückst so dem Spiel Deinen Stempel auf. Und in högschder Not bedienst Du Dich auch mal unkonventioneller Mittel.nDein #Suff Vorteil:

  • Dein Foto oder Logo auf der Startseite von www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de
  • Link zu einer Website Deiner Wahl
  • Social Post mit allen Sechsern
  • Freikarte für Fortuna-Spiel Deiner Wahl
  • Sticker & Buttons
  • Persönliches Anschreiben

FALSCHE NEUN (250€, 15 Pakete):Du bist eine Modeerscheinung im modernen Fußball, treibst zwischen den Linien Dein Unwesen und machst uns durch Dein variables Spiel unberechenbar. Dein #Suff Vorteil:

  • Mittelgroßes Foto oder Logo auf der Startseite von www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de
  • Persönliches Sponsoren-Profil
  • Individueller Social Post
  • 2 Freikarten für Fortuna-Heimspiel Deiner Wahl
  • Sticker & Buttons
  • Persönliches Anschreiben

FLÜGELZANGE (500€, 10 Pakete):Du bist eine Modeerscheinung im modernen Fußball, treibst zwischen den Linien Dein Unwesen und machst uns durch Dein variables Spiel unberechenbar. Dein #Suff Vorteil:

  • Mittelgroßes Foto oder Logo auf der Startseite von www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de
  • Persönliches Sponsoren-Profil
  • Individueller Social Post
  • 2 Freikarten für Fortuna-Heimspiel Deiner Wahl
  • Sticker & Buttons
  • Persönliches Anschreiben

ZEHNER (1000€, 5 Pakete):Du bist Herz und Kopf der Mannschaft, sorgst mit Deinen Geistesblitzen für Verwirrung beim Gegner und zelebrierst den tödlichen Pass mit mikrochirurgischer Präzision. Dein #Suff Vorteil:

  • 25x25cm Logo auf TV-relevanter Bande im Südstadion
  • Premium Sponsoren-Profil oben auf der Startseite von www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de
  • Fortuna-Trikot und Merchandise (Schal + Tasse)
  • Persönliche Auslieferung
  • 6 Freikarten für Fortuna-Heimspiele
  • 3 individuelle Social Post
  • #Suff-Rabatte
  • Sticker & Buttons

VOLLSTRECKER (2000€, 2 Pakete): Keiner weiß, wie Du es machst, aber Du bist immer zur richtigen Zeit am richtigen Ort und versenkst die Dinger gnadenlos im gegnerischen Tor. Dein #Suff Vorteil:

  • 50x50cm Logo auf TV-relevanter Bande im Südstadion
  • Premium Sponsoren-Profil auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de
  • 2x Meet&Greet mit Spielern oder Bossen von Fortuna
  • Signiertes Fortuna-Trikot und Merchandise (Schal + Tasse)
  • Dauerkarte für Fortuna-Heimspiele
  • Persönliche Auslieferung
  • 5 individuelle Social Post
  • #Suff-Rabatte

Wie wird mein Profil auf der Seite Startups-fuer-fortuna.de dargestellt?

Auf euern Wunsch liebe #Suff-Freunde und Förderer, hat sich Jan in der Sonne von Palermo ans Werk gemacht und skizziert, wie genau unsere Seite www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de aussehen wird, wenn sich bis zum 9.9.14 ausreichend #Suff-Mitglieder hier auf I diegogo finden.

Im Grunde sind die Skizzen selbsterklärend, trotzdem nochmal alles in Stichpunkten:

  • Für alle Sponsoren ab einer Einwechselgebühr von 250€ gilt: ihr erhaltet alle ein eigenes Profil und je nach Paketgröße (siehe Skizzen) variiert eure Prominenz auf der Seite.
  • Alle 100€-Sponsoren können ihr Logo auf der Seite platzieren. Klickt man darauf, wird man auf eure Seite umgeleitet.
  • Die 10€, 25€ und 50€ Sponsoren werden namentlich erwähnt. Die Namen der 50€ Sponsoren werden ebenfalls mit einem Hyperlink versehen, der auf die Website eurer Wahl führt.

Weitere Fragen können wir gerne im Chat oder per PN diskutieren. Im übrigen können wir auch analog, gerne treffen wir uns mit euch oder euren Chefs und erklären euch persönlich alles rund um Startups für Fortuna.

WICHTIGWir haben intern beschlossen, dass die Logos der #Suff-Mitspieler ab 1000€ - neben unserem Namen - mit auf die Bande dürfen. Hierzu müssen wir lediglich noch Rücksprache mit Fortuna Köln halten.

Was passiert mit dem Geld bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung?

6.000€: 6 Meter TV-relevante Bandenwerbung mit dem „Startup für Fortuna“ Logo und weitere Sponsoring Maßnahmen

12.000€: 12 Meter TV-relevante Bandenwerbung mit dem „Startup für Fortuna“ Logo und weitere Sponsoring Maßnahmen

18.000€: 18 Meter TV-relevante Bandenwerbung mit dem „Startup für Fortuna“ Logo und weitere Sponsoring Maßnahmen.

Alles was darüber hinaus akquiriert wird, kommt ebenfalls Sponsoring-Maßnahmen von Fortuna Köln zu Gute. Der Fantasie sind dabei keine Grenzen gesetzt.

Wer steht hinter Startups für Fortuna?

Die Unternehmer Jan Kus und Felix Schlebusch verzichten bewusst auf eine fingierte Story, mit überschwänglichem Pathos und geheuchelter Fortuna-Extase. Schlebusch fehlt die Zeit permanent zu seinem Ruhrgebietsverein zu reisen und Kus hat kein Interesse den florierenden Schwarzmarkt beim Stadtrivalen anzuheizen. Bei einem Besuch im Südstadion kam beiden die Idee den Traditionsverein Fortuna Köln bei seiner Auferstehung zu unterstützen und sich bei Wind und Wetter zu jedem Heimspiel auf den Weg ins Südstadion zu machen, um dort - Kölsch trinkend - 3. Liga-Fußball zu sehen und mindestens 19mal im Jahr gemeinsam zu jubeln, zu trauern und ganz nebenbei neue Ideen zu entwerfen. Beim recherchieren der Dauerkarten-Preise sind die beiden Freunde und Jungunternehmer dann auf das Thema Sponsoring gestoßen. Schnell war klar, dass ein Haufen Arbeit auf sie zukommen würde. Warum nicht das eigene Netzwerk beleben, Freunde und Kollegen einladen, um gemeinsam 19mal im Jahr - Kölsch trinkend - zu jubeln, zu trauern und ganz nebenbei neue Ideen zu entwerfen?
story_txt:
UPDATE vom 28.08.2014: Wir zeigen Euch wie Euer Profil auf der Seite aussehen wird!!!!! Siehe auch Abschnitt Darstellung.
Kurzbeschreibung
UPDATE vom 29.08.2014: Wir haben die Perks überarbeitet und noch mehr #suff Vorteile eingebaut! Siehe auch Abschnitt Pakete. Jetzt unterstützen!
Kurzbeschreibung
„Startups für Fortuna“ (#SUFF) unterstützt den 3. Ligisten Fortuna Köln durch Bandenwerbung und weitere Sponsoring-Aktivitäten. SUFF ermöglicht Startups, Unternehmen & Fans den Einstieg in die Welt des Sponsorings. Wer hat nicht mal daran gedacht irgendwann in die Fußstapfen von Abramowitsch & Co zu treten. Auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de können die Förderer sich selbst und ihre Projekte präsentieren und/oder gemeinsam im Stadion networken.
Worum geht es bei Startups für Fortuna?
„Startups für Fortuna“ ist ein Zusammenschluss fußballaffiner Kölner Jungunternehmer, ambitionierter Einzelpersonen und Fans, die Fortuna Köln in der Saison 2014/2015 durch Sponsoring und ihre Anwesenheit im Südstadion unterstützen wollen. Zu jedem Heimspiel treffen sich die Förderer von „Startups für Fortuna“ in einem festgelegten Stadionbereich treffen, erkennen einander am SUFF-Button und haben so die Möglichkeit gemeinsam 19mal im Jahr - Kölsch trinkend - zu jubeln, zu trauern und ganz nebenbei neue Ideen zu entwerfen. Hierzu ist jedes SUFF-Mitglied (Spende ab 5€) herzlich eingeladenen. Die Höhe der Spende spielt bei den Community-Treffen vor Ort im Stadion keine Rolle. Entsprechend der Spendenhöhe erhält jeder Förderer sein eigenes Profil auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de. Die Initiatoren von „Startups für Fortuna“ arbeiten zu 100 Prozent ehrenamtlich.
Was sind die Ziele und wer die Zielgruppe?
Finanzielle Unterstützung von Fortuna Köln und Aufbau eines fußballaffinen Netzwerks Kölner Startups, Jungunternehmer und Fans, die sich gemeinsam auf der Seite www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de präsentieren.
Warum sollte man Startups für Fortuna unterstützen?
VISIONÄR SEIN: Teilnehmer von „Startups für Fortuna“ betreten Neuland im deutschen Profi-Fußball. Dass sich Jungunternehmer einer Stadt zusammenschließen, um den zweiten Verein am Platz finanziell im Namen einer ehrenamtlichen „Dachorganisation“ zu unterstützen, das gibt es so in Deutschland noch nicht.
MÄZEN SEIN: Wer hat nicht schon mal darüber nachgedacht in der Haut von Roman Abramowitch, Dietmar Hopp oder eines ambitionierten Scheichs zu stecken und auf den Platz herunterzuschauen und seine Mannschaft spielen zu sehen. „Startups für Fortuna“ bietet einen kostensensiblen Einstieg ins Fußball-Sponsoring.
PRÄSENZ: Jeder Förderer von „Startups für Fortuna“ erhält ein der Größe seiner Spende entsprechendes Profil auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de. Außerdem winken weitere Vorteile, wie Sponsoring-Pakete, Freikarten, Medienpräsenz, bis hin zu Meet&Greetz mit Spielern und Testimonials. Außerdem kann jeder, sowohl vor Ort als auch im TV, voller Stolz die eigene Stadionbande und weitere Aktionen begutachten.
IDENTIFIKATION: Köln ist eine Stadt mit der man sich identifizieren muss. Ob Karneval, Dom oder - für einige - der Club aus Müngersdorf. Für einige aber auch nicht. Zum Beispiel für die, die jahrelang, auch in schlechten Zeiten, Fortuna Köln die Treue gehalten haben. Und was ist mit all denjenigen, die noch keinen eigenen Verein haben, aber nicht auf Geißböcke stehen. Und was ist mit all den Neu-Kölnern deren Herz für den Heimatverein schlägt? All die lädt „Startups für Fortuna“ ein sich zu engagieren und mit Fortuna zu identifzieren.
EHRENAMT: Die Initiatoren von „Startups für Fortuna“ arbeiten ehrenamtlich.
NETZWERKEN: Wenn sich Samstag für Samstag junge visionäre Unternehmer beim Kölsch zum Fußball gucken treffen, dann entstehen u.a. solche Ideen wie „Startups für Fortuna“. Wer weiß was noch für Ideen entstehen?
AB IN DIE CROWD-CLOUD: Weil es nichts Besseres gibt, als mit anderen Startup-Kollegen biertrinkend Fußball zu gucken und im Anschluss zu networken oder ggfs. noch weiter zu ziehen.
Folgende Pakete bieten wir an
RESERVIST (5 €): Startups für Fortuna braucht Dich, denn Du bist allzeit bereit, das Team zu verstärken. Dein #Suff Vorteil:
	

Sticker
Dein Name im Stadion

KEEPER (10€): Du bist eine sichere Bank und gleichzeitig der Garant für unseren Erfolg. Dein #Suff Vorteil:
	

Sticker
Button
Dein Name im Stadion

AUßENVERTEIDIGER (25€):Du marschierst die Linie unermüdlich auf und ab und sorgst für die perfekte Bananenflanke ins Sturmzentrum. Dein #Suff Vorteil:
	

Dein Name auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de

Sticker
Button

INNENVERTEIDIGER (50€):Gegen Dich bekommen die gegnerischen Stürmer keinen Stich und Deine Ausflüge in den gegnerischen 16er lehren jedem Gegner das Fürchten. Dein #Suff Vorteil:


Dein Name auf www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de mit Link zu einer Website Deiner Wahl
Social Post mit allen Innenverteidigern
Sticker & Button

SECHSER (100€, 25 Pakete): Du sorgst für Stabilität und Struktur im Spielaufbau und drückst so dem Spiel Deinen Stempel auf. Und in högschder Not bedienst Du Dich auch mal unkonventioneller Mittel.nDein #Suff Vorteil:


Dein Foto oder Logo auf der Startseite von www.startups-fuer-fortuna.de

Link zu einer Website Deiner Wahl
Social Post mit allen Sechsern
Freikarte für Fortuna-Spiel Deiner Wahl
Sticker & Buttons
Persönliches Anschreiben

story:
Short Summary

Best Buddies® is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to establishing a global volunteer movement that creates opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment and leadership development for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD).


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The proceeds raised allows for individuals with disabilities to participate in events amongst peers(Bowling, participate in local field trips, etc) . 
  • The budget allows college peers to mentor individuals with behavioral and intellectual disabilities through on campus events. 
  • Allows buddies to fulfill personal goals and hurdles that are faced throughout both their high school and college years. 
  • Proceeds raised allow for purchase of clothes and other necessities for buddies as well as a long term mentor that they can lean on. 
  • Donations ensure that any individual with a disability can have membership in Best Buddies regardless of financial status. 

The Impact

  • Through the constant encouragement and backing of Best Buddies MKY, Buddy director Alexis Cain, recently joined a sorority on campus and has since impacted the nation. Cain says "it was through her friendships gained in best buddies, it influenced her to become apart of greek life at Murray State." Alexis will now be attending the 27th annual Best Buddies Leadership Conference, in Bloomington Indiana. The conference provides courses in leadership skills and allows her to meet other individuals with equally impacting stories worldwide. It is because of donations such as this that we are able to provide these types of opportunities for our buddies. 
Alexis Cain becomes first individual with Down Syndrome to be accepted into a sorority. 
 WATCH BID ACCEPTANCE HERE
Alexis visits Meredith Vieira show
WATCH HERE
  • Since joining with Best Buddies, the philanthropic money raised by the brothers of the Kentucky Epsilon Chapter of Sigma Phi Epsilon has since allowed for 18 more individuals with disabilities to gain membership into the local chapter. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Best Buddies KY currently serves 18 schools in the state of Kentucky. There is currently 100 schools in the state without Best Buddies. 
  • Transportation is a key issue within Best Buddies MKY. a substantial portion of the local chapter lives in rural areas surrounding Murray, Kentucky. It is the hope of the executive team of Best Buddies MKY that more buddies can be reached with  increased availability of transportation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Visit www.bestbuddiesonline.org to find out more ways to help. The volunteer section of the website features many different ways to help. 
  • Participate in local Special Olympics Programs and support those individuals whenever possible. 
  • Start your own chapter, whatever age group, Elementary through College.

story:
Mouth Meets South Featured on



Featured on: Bridey O'Leary Blog


Mouth Meets South™ conveniently provides delicious and savory soul food in your local grocery store. Be reminded of classic, home-cooked, meals handed down from generation to generation.

 

 

According to the American Frozen Food Institute, the average American eats 12 frozen meals a month, making frozen food meals a $9 billion per year industry. However, there are no frozen meals that represent soul food and Southern food, down-home cuisine that originated with African Americans in the Southern United States hundreds of years ago that is still a traditional favorite for African Americans and Southerners alike. 

Barbecue ribs, fried catfish, smothered pork chops, fried chicken, macaroni and cheese, corn pudding, candied yams, steamed cabbage, collard greens, mustard greens, black-eyed peas, cornbread, and more! Mmm, Mmm!

By taking the freshest ingredients and using cutting-edge technology to flash freeze and preserve their freshness and deliciousness, we are bringing the culture of soul food and Southern cuisine to your family’s dinner table. Mouth Meets South™ brings our table to your family, and brings your family together. Culture. Tradition. Comfort. Home.


Mouth Meets South™ - Why It Matters

Step into your local grocer’s freezer aisle and you’ll see plenty of frozen pizza, chicken pot pies, and microwave dinner choices. There are American microwave meals. Asian frozen meals. Italian microwave meals. Greek microwave meals. Mexican frozen meals. East Indian frozen meals. Low-cal frozen meals. Gluten-free frozen meals. But there are no frozen meals that represent soul food and Southern food. You know, down-home cuisine.

I created Mouth Meets South™ to fill a significant void in the frozen meal grocery segment by bringing a variety of savory and delicious soul food frozen meals to grocers’ freezers for the first time in history.



$5 Sure - I'll Help You!

It feels good to help someone realize a life-long dream of creating a product that currently doesn’t exist and will please so many!



$10 Me Too!

Your memories and my memories about down-home cooking are so, so similar. Culture. Tradition. Comfort. Home. Count me in as a fan.



$15 Social Media Shout Out

See your name in the social media spotlight as we thank you, big supporter. I know and now everyone else will know that you've stepped in to help bring our amazing food to food lovers everywhere.



$35 MMS Exclusive T-Shirt

You'll be one of the few to receive an exclusive Mouth Meets South™ T-Shirt. Wear it proudly! We will follow up after the end of the campaign for your shirt sizes.



$75 MMS Exclusive Apron

Receive a Mouth Meets South™ Apron in a natural/tan color, including the Mouth Meets South™ Logo and slogan "Soul Food in Minutes."



$100 Soul Food Recipe Contest

Submit your favorite recipe to our Mouth Meets South™ Soul Food Recipe Contest. A panel of judges will select the top five (5) soul food recipes to post to the Mouth Meets South™ website with the entrant's name, photo, city/state, and photo of winning dish. Contest ends March 26, 2016. Your recipe could be a bigger story than the now nationally famous sweet potato pie!



$200 Give the Gift of Soul Food

Five coupons, worth $40 each, can be offered as gifts and used to purchase Mouth Meets South™ meals. It's a great way to share your love for this cuisine.



$250 Limited Edition Meals

Receive a Limited Edition Mouth Meets South™ Frozen Meal featuring our Family’s Secret Recipe. Only 25 are available and won’t be available in stores. Get yours today!



$500 Behind-the-Scenes Look

Meet the Mouth Meets South™ founder and hang out for a day. Share your thoughts on how to make this company a winner for all ages and all time. (Travel and lodging arrangements and expenses not included).


$1000 Your Name on the Box

Your name clearly depicted on one of the products of your choice, (ie, "LAST NAME'S FAMOUS SOUTHERN FRIED CHICKEN"). You will get a brief bio on the box with your headshot. Naming rights guaranteed for up to 1 year. Email mouthmeetssouthcampaign@gmail.com with any questions.




The Impact

Your contribution goes a long way in making Mouth Meets South™ widely available. It’s an innovator. A game changer. Soul food has never been offered as a pre-assembled, frozen, microwaveable dinner available in grocery stores. It’s a first! Let’s make it happen.

Mouth Meets South™ will offer several benefits:

Fills current void in marketplace. First-ever soul food frozen meals in grocery stores.

Convenience. Prepared, quality meals available at home when the consumer wants them.

Saves time. No cooking preparation, therefore no clean up.

Meal planning. Makes it easy to determine what’s for lunch or dinner.

Affordable.

Risks and Challenges

As with all ventures, we face some of the normal risks and challenges associated with new businesses. Your support and contributions will help build a strong foundation that will allow Mouth Meets South™ to grow. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Support Us – Watch our amazing campaign video, and check out our great Perks, which include limited edition items, an opportunity to participate in a Soul Food Recipe Contest, and even a Behind-the-Scenes look at Mouth Meets South™!

Join Us – Connect with us online. Let us know your story about soul food, what you love best about it and Southern inspired food, your favorite meals and great memories of sharing meals with family and friends. Your story will inspire even more people.

Forward Us – Help us by sharing Mouth Meets South™ with your friends to help us reach as many people as possible. Post our campaign link: http://igg.me/at/mouthmeetssouth
on Twitter, Facebook, or just share ideas over a dining room table.

Follow us on Twitter

Like us on Facebook 

Follow us on Instagram

Spreading the news will help us raise awareness about our campaign’s aim, catch the attention of future customers, and attract more funding to contribute to this important effort. Best of all, it'll help spark the conversations we need to get great soul food cooking in more households to be enjoyed and to create new memories.

· Send a note of support. Encouragement goes a long way!

· Email, text, tweet, etc., family members and friends who may be interested.

· Mention this initiative throughout your social media community on all of your profiles, walls, forums, pages.

· Suggest to national, local, mainstream, and trade media that it should do a story about Mouth Meets South™.

Share Us – Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Follow Us – Keep in touch with the project and the campaign. We will be providing updates weekly with insights and lots of great information.



Meet the Founder

Tanya M. Howard, the Founder and CEO of Mouth Meets South™, is a foodie, who is fiercely entrepreneurial and creative. She's a former Associated Press reporter and corporate affairs and external relations professional for Fortune 500 companies. A New Jersey native now living in Southeastern Virginia, Howard is a graduate of Ohio State University with an undergraduate degree in News Editorial Journalism and a graduate degree in Management from Antioch University Midwest.


Thank you!
story_txt:
Mouth Meets South Featured on





Featured on: Bridey O'Leary Blog


Mouth Meets South™ conveniently provides delicious and savory soul food in your local grocery store. Be reminded of classic, home-cooked, meals handed down from generation to generation.

 


 


According to the American Frozen Food Institute, the average American eats 12 frozen meals a month, making frozen food meals a $9 billion per year industry. However, there are no frozen meals that represent soul food and Southern food, down-home cuisine that originated with African Americans in the Southern United States hundreds of years ago that is still a traditional favorite for African Americans and Southerners alike. 
Barbecue ribs, fried catfish, smothered pork chops, fried chicken, macaroni and cheese, corn pudding, candied yams, steamed cabbage, collard greens, mustard greens, black-eyed peas, cornbread, and more! Mmm, Mmm!
By taking the freshest ingredients and using cutting-edge technology to flash freeze and preserve their freshness and deliciousness, we are bringing the culture of soul food and Southern cuisine to your family’s dinner table. Mouth Meets South™ brings our table to your family, and brings your family together. Culture. Tradition. Comfort. Home.

Mouth Meets South™ - Why It Matters
Step into your local grocer’s freezer aisle and you’ll see plenty of frozen pizza, chicken pot pies, and microwave dinner choices. There are American microwave meals. Asian frozen meals. Italian microwave meals. Greek microwave meals. Mexican frozen meals. East Indian frozen meals. Low-cal frozen meals. Gluten-free frozen meals. But there are no frozen meals that represent soul food and Southern food. You know, down-home cuisine.
I created Mouth Meets South™ to fill a significant void in the frozen meal grocery segment by bringing a variety of savory and delicious soul food frozen meals to grocers’ freezers for the first time in history.



$5 Sure - I'll Help You!
It feels good to help someone realize a life-long dream of creating a product that currently doesn’t exist and will please so many!
Click Here to Donate $5 to Mouth Meets South™!

$10 Me Too!
Your memories and my memories about down-home cooking are so, so similar. Culture. Tradition. Comfort. Home. Count me in as a fan.
Click Here to Donate $10 to Mouth Meets South™!



$15 Social Media Shout Out
See your name in the social media spotlight as we thank you, big supporter. I know and now everyone else will know that you've stepped in to help bring our amazing food to food lovers everywhere.
Click Here to Donate $15 to Mouth Meets South™!



$35 MMS Exclusive T-Shirt
You'll be one of the few to receive an exclusive Mouth Meets South™ T-Shirt. Wear it proudly! We will follow up after the end of the campaign for your shirt sizes.
Click Here to Donate $35 to Mouth Meets South™!



$75 MMS Exclusive Apron
Receive a Mouth Meets South™ Apron in a natural/tan color, including the Mouth Meets South™ Logo and slogan "Soul Food in Minutes."
Click Here to Donate $75 to Mouth Meets South™!



$100 Soul Food Recipe Contest
Submit your favorite recipe to our Mouth Meets South™ Soul Food Recipe Contest. A panel of judges will select the top five (5) soul food recipes to post to the Mouth Meets South™ website with the entrant's name, photo, city/state, and photo of winning dish. Contest ends March 26, 2016. Your recipe could be a bigger story than the now nationally famous sweet potato pie!
Click Here to Donate $100 to Mouth Meets South™!



$200 Give the Gift of Soul Food
Five coupons, worth $40 each, can be offered as gifts and used to purchase Mouth Meets South™ meals. It's a great way to share your love for this cuisine.
Click Here to Donate $200 to Mouth Meets South™!



$250 Limited Edition Meals
Receive a Limited Edition Mouth Meets South™ Frozen Meal featuring our Family’s Secret Recipe. Only 25 are available and won’t be available in stores. Get yours today!
Click Here to Donate $250 to Mouth Meets South™!



$500 Behind-the-Scenes Look
Meet the Mouth Meets South™ founder and hang out for a day. Share your thoughts on how to make this company a winner for all ages and all time. (Travel and lodging arrangements and expenses not included).

Click Here to Donate $500 to Mouth Meets South™!


$1000 Your Name on the Box
Your name clearly depicted on one of the products of your choice, (ie, "LAST NAME'S FAMOUS SOUTHERN FRIED CHICKEN"). You will get a brief bio on the box with your headshot. Naming rights guaranteed for up to 1 year. Email mouthmeetssouthcampaign@gmail.com with any questions.
Click Here to Donate $1000 to Mouth Meets South™!


The Impact
Your contribution goes a long way in making Mouth Meets South™ widely available. It’s an innovator. A game changer. Soul food has never been offered as a pre-assembled, frozen, microwaveable dinner available in grocery stores. It’s a first! Let’s make it happen.
Mouth Meets South™ will offer several benefits:
Fills current void in marketplace. First-ever soul food frozen meals in grocery stores.
Convenience. Prepared, quality meals available at home when the consumer wants them.
Saves time. No cooking preparation, therefore no clean up.
Meal planning. Makes it easy to determine what’s for lunch or dinner.
Affordable.
Risks and Challenges
As with all ventures, we face some of the normal risks and challenges associated with new businesses. Your support and contributions will help build a strong foundation that will allow Mouth Meets South™ to grow. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Support Us – Watch our amazing campaign video, and check out our great Perks, which include limited edition items, an opportunity to participate in a Soul Food Recipe Contest, and even a Behind-the-Scenes look at Mouth Meets South™!
Join Us – Connect with us online. Let us know your story about soul food, what you love best about it and Southern inspired food, your favorite meals and great memories of sharing meals with family and friends. Your story will inspire even more people.
Forward Us – Help us by sharing Mouth Meets South™ with your friends to help us reach as many people as possible. Post our campaign link: http://igg.me/at/mouthmeetssouth
on Twitter, Facebook, or just share ideas over a dining room table.
Follow us on Twitter
Like us on Facebook 
Follow us on Instagram
Spreading the news will help us raise awareness about our campaign’s aim, catch the attention of future customers, and attract more funding to contribute to this important effort. Best of all, it'll help spark the conversations we need to get great soul food cooking in more households to be enjoyed and to create new memories.

story:
Every year, Delta Tau Delta Fraternity at The George Washington University hosts our annual fall philanthropy, Delt’s Taugate. This year, all proceeds raised during Taugate 2015 will directly benefit DC Candlelighters Childhood Cancer Foundation. DC Candlelighters is a 501(c)3 non-profit support group for families with children of cancer in the Washington, DC metropolitan area (including Northern Virginia and Maryland), and is affiliated with the American Childhood Cancer Organization.

Delt’s Taugate is a tailgate themed philanthropy with all events taking place at The George Washington University between October 15th-18th. All of the sororities on campus will be competing in different competitions throughout the weekend, culminating in our Capitol Cornhole Tournament on Sunday, October 18th.

Last year, Delt’s Taugate raised over $27,000 for Rare Cancer Research as well as for the medical expenses of Tom Syron, a four-time cancer fighter and father of one of our own brothers.

Our brotherhood is very excited to host another successful Taugate, and we are hoping to count on the support of our family and friends in D.C. and around the country. Please consider donating, sharing this page, and supporting the fraternity's philanthropic efforts, DC Candlelighters Childhood Cancer Foundation, and our surrounding community!

story:
Our family has been farming over 40 years in middle Tennessee raising vegetables and animals organically and sustainably.  We are a multi-generation farm with Mom, Dad at the helm, the kids Hank growing organic vegetables and Amy raising animals along with all the grandkids.  For over a decade we have anchored farmers markets in the Nashville area and have operated a vegetable CSA program for more than 12 years.  This year we have added a meat CSA to our farm shares with our pasture raised beef, lamb, chicken and pork.  We have always dreamed of having a farm store that our friends and community can buy our vegetables straight off the farm and we hope that you can back our campaign to make it happen.

   

We bought this land with the barn 7 years ago, and quickly realized that this would be the perfect spot for a farm store.  The barn was built over 80 years ago to store tobacco from the 50 acres of adjacent farm land.  It has seen a lot of use over the years and has cured countless acres of tobacco and is still in use today.  Our vision is to extend the life and function of this barn by adding a farm store on the front half facing the road.  The barn will become the focal point of our storefront and function as a place for our community to visit the farm and buy our freshly harvested vegetables right where they are grown.  

 

Instead of adjacent tobacco fields, we are adding acres of strawberries that will become an organic “pick your own”, strawberry patch.  Future expansions will likely include pick your own herb gardens, blackberries, blueberries and pumpkins.  Kids and grown ups alike will delight in harvesting their own fresh berries and seeing first hand what it takes to grow organic vegetables. We love sharing our farm with our customers and meeting the people who will be eating our organic vegetables that we work so hard to grow.  


Our farm store will be a seasonal shop open from May to November.  We will be offering all of our organic produce we grown on the farm as well as some specialty items like peaches, apples, milk and cheese from our neighboring farms.  Strawberries, lettuce, kales, cabbages, potatoes, eggplant, cherry tomatoes, heirloom tomatoes, summer squashes, cucumbers, corn, melons, cantaloupe, apples, okra, broccoli, turnips, greens, butternut, acorn squash, pumpkins and sweet potatoes are some of the many vegetables we grow that you will find in our farm store. 

Last year we installed 10Kw of solar panels to the barn with anticipation of adding a farm store in the near future.   The solar panels generate clean, green electricity that will be used in our refrigeration units, lights and HVAC.  The store will extend out from the first level, we are adding a 15 foot high roof line along the length of the barn.  A concrete slab will be poured for the floor of the store and front porch area.  New wood planking will be installed on the facade of the barn.  We will use all the old barn lumber inside the store to build the shelfing, tables and paneling.  A small cooler unit and racks will be added to the back of the store to wash, hydrate and cool the produce as it comes from the fields.  A gravel parking lot will be constructed on the front of the barn for parking.  

 

Your support of our campaign will help us get started right away with the buildout and construction of our farm store.  Our goal is to complete this project in the off season this winter.  We’ll be doing the construction ourselves with our farm labor.  This is a big farm project that we're excited to take on and to turn our old barn into something that can be enjoyed for many decades to come.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Kiki Pertesis and I am the owner and practitioner of The Little Owl Spa. I offer massage therapy, skin care and waxing services. The spa opened 5 years ago on the 2nd floor of  an office building with very little visibility and accessibility. I originally opened the space in hopes of serving at most 4 clients a week. Amazingly, through word of mouth and great online reviews, the spa is now serving over 35 clients a week! I've had to hire another massage therapist to help  take on the new clientele.  The small 300 square foot space is not capable of receiving more than 1 client at a time. Initially, lack of a bathroom in the space, limited parking and only one treatment room, were not an issue. Now, with so many clients and new clients booking everyday, it is time for the Little Owl to flap its wings and fly!

I have been so blessed with our clientele at The Little Owl Spa. The clients feel more like family to me and I want to continue to treat them in a beautiful, healing environment that is more accessible and more comfortable. I want to expand the service menu and include more healing arts such as energy healing, eastern massage and body treatments. I am also looking into purchasing innovative skin care equipment to assist in anti-aging and acne solutions.   Jumping from a small 300 square foot space to a space that is 3 times the size is a huge leap and will need lots of focus, love and financial backing. We need help to make this happen!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need at least $10,000.00 to assist us with opening costs including construction and new equipment. We really want to make the new space very special, inviting and beautiful so that clients truly feel like they are transported and relaxed.
  • There are some awesome perks for your help! You can enjoy spa services once it is opened for your help!

The Impact

What I have learned in the past 5 years is that people need spas. Not only to relax but to feel loved, cared for and treated kindly in an inspiring atmosphere. The Little Owl Spa truly works from the heart and combines knowledge of the services it provides with great customer care. When I opened the spa in 2011, I never imagined it would be serving 40 clients a week. The spa was intended on serving a few clients here and there which is why I placed it on the second floor of an office building.   Without any advertising, on-street appeal or store frontage it has outgrown it's space by word of mouth and great online reviews. 

I truly believe that if the spa were in a more accessible location with better parking and more services it would grow even further. I will always maintain a very boutique style space to ensure individual care but a larger space would ensure that more clients are able to be treated in a more timely and comfortable manner. 

Risks & Challenges

I have no fear of the success of a new location however there are still some challenges in finding it. I have some very precise desires for the new location. I would like the space to stay in the Poughkeepsie area to cater to it's current clientele. I am also looking for a space with sufficient free parking as well as wheel chair accessibility. Lastly, I need a space that is large enough to have a few more rooms but also affordable. I am constantly looking for all options whether that be to buy a place or lease and I know the perfect spot is just around the corner. The contributions for clientele and fans will really help widen the possibilities so that we can move soon and efficiently. 

 

Other ways to help:

Even if you are unable to donate, please share the page, video and campaign with everyone you can. Facebook, twitter and instagram are great tools to help spread the word. Please use the tools on indiegogo page to share with friends and family!

story:
THE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN IS OVER, BUT YOU CAN STILL CONTRIBUTE HERE. 

Please write "Guinea Water Project" in the special instructions box.


Saving Lives, Uplifting Health

The Guinea Water Project is a volunteer campaign founded in Chicago, raising money to support Guineans and Americans working together to make sustainable biosand water filters. It costs $300 to make a filter which provides safe drinking water for ten people for ten years, freeing them from common waterborne diseases, including bacterial and protozoal diarrhea, hepatitis A, and typhoid fever.

Each of us can make a difference

With your help, we will raise $15,000 or more in the fall of 2014 to make more filters, and acquire molds, generators, drying racks, and other tools to build filter-making capacity.


We are all volunteers- artists, video makers, civil servants, web marketers, chefs and others- putting our talents together because we believe everyone should have access to safe water, so they will have the opportunity to build better lives for themselves, their families, and their community. 

All of the money raised will go to the Motherland Rhythm Community, Benkadi Project. The Motherland Rhythm Community is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization which aids the people in Guinea, and offers programs in the U.S.

Thank you to Greenheart International by making a $1,000 contribution to become a lead sponsor of The Guinea Water Project

"In Guinea, people often drink from polluted streams and contaminated wells, causing serious and recurring illness and even death from cholera, dysentery, typhoid and E. Coli bacteria. Something as simple as clean drinking water can literally save lives in Guinea. Our organization builds and delivers innovative biosand water filters to homes in Guinea to address this problem. We employ community members to construct the filters and teach residents how to use them.”
-Benkadi Project co-founder
Helen Bond, on
Chicago Public Radio’s WorldView

​Already, the Bekadai Project has installed a solar device and distributed self-contained solar lights; built and maintained a new school house while improving the old one and providing benches, tables and supplies; taken one village from one well to four; repaired a neighboring village well; built a youth center; and provided food, agricultural and emergency medical assistance. 

The Benkadi Project grew out of a trip which Helen Bond and Amy Lusk made to Guinea in 2001 to discover the birthplace of the Djembe Drum, their musical passion.What started as a trip grew into a relationship, which became a collaboration.

It began with the schoolhouse, which gave 140 children their first opportunity to attend school, learn to read and write, learn French (the language of business and politics in Guinea) and learn about the world outside of their small, isolated village. From there, the Project spread to include a holistic approach to community improvement.


The Benkadi Project began to make Biosand Water Filters and they quickly became one of the most effective tools available to improve health and reduce poverty. Guinea is one of the poorest countries in the world, where most people earn less than a dollar a day. Half the population lacks access to improved water sources, and contaminated water has led to epidemics of cholera and diarrhea.

The Guineans and Americans in the Benkadi Project worked together to create an efficient process for making biosand filters. Materials and molds are expensive, but Benkadi can assemble them and distribute them to those in need quickly and cheaply. In 2013, their first year making biosand filters, they made and distributed 68 filters, which will supply safe drinking water to 680 individuals for the next ten years. Already, they have obtained funding to make 200 filters for 2,000 people this year. With your help, they will expand their capacity even more. 

A Biosand Filter (BSF)is an adaptation of the traditional slow sand filter, which has been used for community drinking water treatment for 200 years. It is filled with layers of specially selected and prepared sand and gravel. The sand removes pathogens and suspended solids from contaminated drinking water. A biolayer of bacteria and other micro-organisms which grows in the top sand eats many of the pathogens in the water.


How the Money Will be Used

100% of the money raised in the campaign will be used by the Motherland Rhythm Community to make and distribute biosand filters, or to build capacity for making and distributing biosand filters. Specific uses include:

Making more filters. Each filter costs $300 to make. Since a filter provides clean drinking water for ten people for ten years, a biosand filter can give a person safe drinking water for less than a penny a day.

A large, high quality electric generator. Currently, night work is impossible due to lack of power. Ideally, the generator would be large enough to power some of the welding work. Estimated cost: $2,500-$5,000.

Once we have an adequate source of electricity, we would like to acquire two to four concrete shakers, which will improve the quality of the filters, reduce repairs and allow us to use our helpers more efficiently. Estimated cost is $600-$1,000 per shaker, including the cost of mounting the shakers to the existing molds.

Additional filtering screens to improve our current filtering systems which are sifted by hand, and purchase additional mesh screens to expand this process. Estimated cost: $1000 - $1,500


Water storage tanks. Water is essential for our production process, but our 3,000 litre tank is inadequate. Estimated cost: $1,500.

Additional concrete molds. More molds would allow us to make more filters, but they are expensive and challenging to make. In the past, they have taken one to two months to make, as our machinist has travelled from town to town following changing electricity availability. Estimated cost: $1,500 per mold.


Reliable, used off-road vehicle. Good roads are extremely rare in Guinea. A vehicle is essential both for acquiring supplies, and for delivering finished filters. The first filters made went to the nearest communities, and the vehicle will be even more important as we expand our impact. The Motherland Rhythm Community has already secured some funding toward the vehicle.

Something as simple as clean drinking water can literally save lives in Guinea. Our organization builds and delivers innovative biosand water filters to homes in Guinea to address this problem. We employ community members to construct the filters and teach residents how to use them.”-Benkadi Project co-founderHelen Bond, onChicago Public Radio’s WorldView




​Already, the Bekadai Project has installed a solar device and distributed self-contained solar lights; built and maintained a new school house while improving the old one and providing benches, tables and supplies; taken one village from one well to four; repaired a neighboring village well; built a youth center; and provided food, agricultural and emergency medical assistance. 


The Benkadi Project grew out of a trip which Helen Bond and Amy Lusk made to Guinea in 2001 to discover the birthplace of the Djembe Drum, their musical passion.What started as a trip grew into a relationship, which became a collaboration.



It began with the schoolhouse, which gave 140 children their first opportunity to attend school, learn to read and write, learn French (the language of business and politics in Guinea) and learn about the world outside of their small, isolated village. From there, the Project spread to include a holistic approach to community improvement.


The Benkadi Project began to make Biosand Water Filters and they quickly became one of the most effective tools available to improve health and reduce poverty. Guinea is one of the poorest countries in the world, where most people earn less than a dollar a day. Half the population lacks access to improved water sources, and contaminated water has led to epidemics of cholera and diarrhea.



The Guineans and Americans in the Benkadi Project worked together to create an efficient process for making biosand filters. Materials and molds are expensive, but Benkadi can assemble them and distribute them to those in need quickly and cheaply. In 2013, their first year making biosand filters, they made and distributed 68 filters, which will supply safe drinking water to 680 individuals for the next ten years. Already, they have obtained funding to make 200 filters for 2,000 people this year. With your help, they will expand their capacity even more. 

A Biosand Filter (BSF)is an adaptation of the traditional slow sand filter, which has been used for community drinking water treatment for 200 years. It is filled with layers of specially selected and prepared sand and gravel. The sand removes pathogens and suspended solids from contaminated drinking water. A biolayer of bacteria and other micro-organisms which grows in the top sand eats many of the pathogens in the water. 


How the Money Will be Used
100% of the money raised in the campaign will be used by the Motherland Rhythm Community to make and distribute biosand filters, or to build capacity for making and distributing biosand filters. Specific uses include:
Making more filters. Each filter costs $300 to make. Since a filter provides clean drinking water for ten people for ten years, a biosand filter can give a person safe drinking water for less than a penny a day.


A
large, high quality electric generator. Currently, night work is
impossible due to lack of power. Ideally, the generator would be
large enough to power some of the welding work. Estimated cost:
$2,500-$5,000.


Once
we have an adequate source of electricity, we would like to acquire
two to four concrete shakers, which will improve the quality of the
filters, reduce repairs and allow us to use our helpers more
efficiently. Estimated cost is $600-$1,000 per shaker, including the
cost of mounting the shakers to the existing molds.

Additional
filtering screens to improve our current filtering systems which are
sifted by hand, and purchase additional mesh screens to expand this
process. Estimated cost: $1000 - $1,500


Water storage tanks. Water is essential for our production process, but our 3,000 litre tank is inadequate. Estimated cost: $1,500.

Additional concrete molds. More molds would allow us to make more filters, but they are expensive and challenging to make. In the past, they have taken one to two months to make, as our machinist has travelled from town to town following changing electricity availability. Estimated cost: $1,500 per mold.



Reliable, used off-road vehicle. Good roads are extremely rare in Guinea. A vehicle is essential both for acquiring supplies, and for delivering finished filters. The first filters made went to the nearest communities, and the vehicle will be even more important as we expand our impact. The Motherland Rhythm Community has already secured some funding toward the vehicle.

story:
Short Summary

Thanks to our vibrant community of yogis, we started out of nothing a year ago and transitioned into something pretty special. As Indiana's only by-donation yoga studio, we're able to offer yoga to absolutely anyone, regardless of income level. We're also proud to be the only yoga studio in the BRAG neighborhood! Thanks to your support, we've seen a need for a space of our own, so we're transitioning into a new studio right down the street from our current location. We're so excited to move into Binford Plaza, a strip that is home to popular spots such as Just Judy's cafe, Peak Fitness, and the newly-opened Blind Owl Brewery & Kitchen! As we move into the new location, our schedule will be expanding to offer more in-demand classes. We've heard requests for more evening classes, more gentle/restorative classes, and more workshops. You guys ask, we listen and comply. 

We're thrilled to also bring on local Yin enthusiast, Michelle Finch, for two monthly Yin workshops. Yin yoga is unique in that it uses props, breathing techniques and mindful muscle relaxation to open the body both physically and mentally. But, investing in good quality props is more than we can currently afford as our budget is pretty tight while we make the transition into the new studio.

What We Need & What You Get

Our props supply is off to a good start. We have 30 or so blocks, a couple dozen straps, and we just bought 20 blankets. Here's what else we would like to get started:

  • 20 bolsters @ $50 each
  • 10 (more) blankets @ $20 each 
We have different contribution levels, based on how much you'd like to help us out. Everyone who gives $10 or more will get their own eye pillow.
  • $10 - social media shout out
  • $25 - one group yoga class pass (NOTE: not valid for Yin workshop, exp 12/31/15)
  • $50 - your choice: yoga class pass or Yin workshop (exp 12/31/15)
  • $75 - yoga class pass plus your choice: Yin workshop or blanket (exp 12/31/15)
  • $100 - yoga class, Yin workshop + blanket (exp 12/31/15)
  • $150 - 5 yin workshops (exp 3/31/16)
  • $500 - 6 months of unlimited Yin workshops plus your own blanket (exp 3/31/16)
  • $1000 - Your very own full set of props: eye pillow, blanket, bolster, two blocks and a strap PLUS 6 months unlimited Yin workshops (exp 3/31/16)
So while we're asking for a mere $1200, we'd LOVE to get $1500 so we can get started on folding chairs for our Iyengar-inspired class, Yoga with Props! Any extra funds raised will go towards fulfilling our dream prop station.

The Impact

Even if you're not into Yin yoga, you may find yourself using these props in our regularly-scheduled classes! It may not need explaining, but our Yoga with Props class needs a decent supply of quality props. And in our regular classes, blankets aren't just for keeping warm; they are used a variety of ways - from wedging under the hip in pigeon to aligning and supporting the neck in shoulder stand - and bolsters provide great support for prepping the body to open for more advanced postures, and for under the knees in savasana.

You may remember last August we crowd-funded the seed money needed to get our studio up and running. We kept it relatively simple, asking for just $5,000 to slap some paint on the walls and get the studio basics. You guys came through and fully funded us in just 45 days. We saw that you believed in us, and wanted to contribute to our cause. We're doing another campaign because we see a need for these restorative classes NOW (can the world slow down already?) and we'd rather not make you wait any longer for Yin to come to Breathing Space! We figure there are enough of you out there who are excited to have Yin at the studio (or at least you want an ample supply of all props for your other classes) and are willing to put some money in the pot to help get us set up. This is all part of Breathing Space being a COMMUNITY space of which everyone takes ownership.

Risks & Challenges

We understand that asking for the community's help may not get us to our goal in just 30 days, and that's okay. We've set up this campaign to accept any amount that we raise. We'll get what we can now, and fill it all up as time goes on. Michelle can bring her own props to the Yin workshops, but that is a huge request for her to do every time since those bolsters are big and bulky...what a pain to lug back and forth twice each month! And trust us, our beloved Yin teacher is the last person we need out of commission! ;)

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not have it in your budget to contribute to our campaign, and again, we totally understand and respect that. If you'd still like to support us, we'd love for you to share this with your friends who may be interested. Remember, Yin is a yoga practice appropriate for all adults, no matter the age or mobility level. 
Other than sharing with friends, you can always support us by simply coming to class. Your attendance is valued energetically and helps keep us open financially. While the bulk of our class income goes toward paying bills, as our classes grow, our profit increases and we're able to budget for more props!

Thank you again for your support. Be love.

story:
Bring Pizza + Lasagna Back to De Soto Main Street!

When we opened Lorenzo's Italian Kitchen on De Soto Main Street in 2012, we had no idea how popular our small, family-owned  restaurant would become. Not only did people love our authentic Italian food, Lorenzo's became a community gathering place and sign of hope for the revitalization of downtown De Soto.

Unfortunately, due to a lack of dining space and the prohibitive cost of increasingly necessary repairs at our former location, we had no choice but to close Lorenzo's in June of 2015. 

BUT YOU WANT IT BACK!!! 

Over the past several months, we have been overwhelmed by requests to bring back your favorite Lorenzo's dishes, especially our Pizzas, Salads and Lasagna. We have looked at several options for new Lorenzo's locations within De Soto, but they are all either too big, too small or too expensive to renovate. 

So, as so many of you have requested, here's what we want to do: BRING A TASTE OF LORENZO'S TO THE MENU AT SAVANNAH'S SMOKEHOUSE.

BBQ and Pizza? Why not!!! We've always been a little bit unconventional anyway.

Here's the problem. In order for us to serve Pizza, Lasagna and a few of your other Italian favorites at Savannah's, we need to renovate and redesign our kitchen space. And that costs MONEY.

We invested quite a lot to build Savannah's (and our efforts have paid off - in just 5 short months we became the 2nd Best BBQ in Jefferson County!!) But we're tapped out, and we just don't have a money tree in our backyard. 

So if you want to see some of your Lorenzo's favorites available again on De Soto Main Street, we're asking for your help to raise the $16,500 we need to make this happen.

Here's what your contribution will help go towards:    

  • New Equipment: Including a pizza oven capable of cooking pizzas in less than 2 minutes, coolers, beer cooler, dough mixer and dishware. 
  • Restructuring the Kitchen Design at Savannah's. This will accommodate preparation of a wider variety of menu options. (Don't worry! All of our award-winning BBQ will still be on the menu too.)
  • A New Dining Counter + Server Station. Yes, we plan to turn Savannah's into a sit-down restaurant with servers, wine and beer. 
  • More Jobs. We'll have to hire servers and additional kitchen staff, which means you'll help bring more jobs to De Soto.
  • A Gathering Place. By adding servers, wine, beer and a more expansive menu, we'll recreate the atmosphere so many of you miss from Lorenzo's. You can expect new hours (Monday-Saturday, Lunch + Dinner) and special, reservation-only Sunday Night Dinners.    
  • The Continued Revitalization of De Soto Main Street. We could have moved Lorenzo's to Festus or Arnold, but we want to maintain our commitment to revitalizing the De Soto community. And you can help by contributing to this project today.

Bottom line: This won't happen without YOU!! 

In the past 3 years, we have developed a reputation in De Soto and throughout Jefferson County, not only for serving great food at both Lorenzo's Italian Kitchen and Savannah's Smokehouse, but also for working hard to ensure quality and authenticity in all that we do. This campaign is no different. And you'll be able to follow our progress every step of the way.

Plus, you'll get some AMAZING perks when you donate!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help us spread the word:

  • Tell your friends! Call them on the phone. Email this link to your contact list. Share the campaign on social media. The more noise we can make, the more money we can raise.
  • Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools! They make sharing even easier!

Thank you in advance for supporting us -- and for supporting De Soto. Through your contribution, you are personally helping to create change and add value to our wonderful community!

story:
Wildthings 

100% Natural, Wildly Effective, Insect Repellent 


Join the revolution in health and body care that returns us to the wisdom of nature.
We believe in keeping ingredients simple and pure.

Our bug repellent is made from the highest quality essential oils,  which are both non-toxic and nourishing for the skin. Originally made as a safe and effective bug repellent for my own children, Wildthings is 100% natural, and contains no synthetic chemicals or artificial additives. And it is wildly effective!

Studies show that one of our ingredients, catmint , is stronger than DEET at repelling mosquitoes. Rose geranium, catmint and witch hazel  are known for their healing, soothing properties. Our essential oils are also commonly used in aromatherapy mixtures to bring a sense of calm and well-being. 

Working with essential oils means working with some of nature's most divine scents. Wildthings comes in 3 varieties: Lavender, Citrus Wildflower, and Forest, which has a hint of patchouli. 

Plants have been in the insect repelling business a few hundred million years longer than we have.  Our bodies have evolved alongside some of these powerful repellent plants in a symbiotic relationship, and perhaps it is no accident that many are plants whose scents are very appealing to us. But we have forgotten much of this basic plant wisdom and  have been led to believe that synthetic alternatives are vastly better. We don't believe that's true. Our goal is to reclaim our relationship with the beneficial and healing properties of plants. To re-wild our lives. To live in balance with nature.


***

Wildthings  and our parent company, Cedarberry,  grew out of founder Monica Campbell's lifelong passion for herbal remedies and natural skin products. We believe that the products that you put on your skin, and on your children's skin, should be totally natural and as pure as possible. Using a blend of sustainably sourced essential oils known for their insect repellent properties, we craft our insect repellent and other body products in small batches using natural, plant-based ingredients that are not only highly effective, but also nourishing for your skin. 


First Steps...

By supporting our campaign, you will be helping us raise a little seed money to get  our business going. You will also get the opportunity to sample our products and offer feedback. But more importantly, you are part of a movement toward a healthier way of living in relationship with nature and a belief that the natural world has deep wisdom that we simply need to remember and tap into. 
Our immediate goal is to provide the best possible products and to raise awareness of the efficacy of natural ingredients.  These products are not only healthier for our bodies and the earth, but we believe that they actually work better  than the synthetic, toxic alternatives. Our future goals include creating insect repelling products for the home as well as pets, reducing the chemical load our bodies are exposed to on a daily basis. 
We've tested and fine-tuned our bugspray recipes, and we have a website, which will open for online business in early December, as soon as the fundraising campaign ends: 
wildthingsbugspray.com
Now we need your help to get production rolling! 

*  5% of the  proceeds from our fundraiser will be donated to support charities we love...  Arcadia Center for Sustainable Food and Agriculture and Panthera


What we offer you...


As perks we are offering Wildthings bugspray as well as some of the natural body products that will be offered through our parent company, Cedarberry. 
AND, because we know the mosquito season is drawing to an end in the northern states, and there's only so much bugspray you can use this time of year, we are also offering some ART, T-shirts, and other curiosities to sweeten the deal! 

Wildthings insect repellent has a good shelf life, and will have you ready for next summer, but you are welcome to opt for delivery in the spring.

**We can only ship Wildthings insect repellent within the United States at this point.

Galleries for the ART perks will go up in early November, with links posted here, and art will be added through the end of the campaign on November 29. Contributors will be able to choose their artwork when the galleries open or any time until December 15. Most of the art is from potion maker and founder, Monica Campbell, but a few pieces may be from other artists.



Some of the goodies included in our perks...


All of our perks for donations  $10 and more include a bottle of Wildthings bug repellent. Many also include a sample of our Cedarberry Body Products.



$ 25 donation or higher - Munky T-shirts! One of our favorite "wildthings" featured on an organic 100% cotton t-shirt. Children's and women's sizes available as well - 100% cotton American Apparel, but not organic . 
*T-shirts printed by the awesome folks at CustomInk

$25 donation or above - 100 % organic "feral" T-shirt and 1 bottle of Wildthings bugspray

Handmade, one of a kind ceramic mugs offered with the $35 thank you perk. Gallery is up, with more work being added over the next month:
http://www.wildthingsbugspray.com/projects/


$50. perk includes various other ceramic art pieces. 
Gallery is up, with more work being added throughout the month.
http://www.wildthingsbugspray.com/projects/

Small framed artworks are included in the $100 perk, along with T-shirt and Wildthings samples.
Gallery is up, and lots more painting will be added SOON!
http://www.wildthingsbugspray.com/projects/


larger art pieces are offered in Galleries 2 and 3 as part of the thank you perks



Backstory...

The story of our insect repellent began during our years working in our organic garden on a little farm in Pennsylvania. We noticed that one of the mint-family plants  that grew wild and abundant on our farm repelled garden pests astonishingly well, while beneficial insects like honeybees and butterflies loved the flowers. It was Nepeta cataria, commonly known as catmint or catnip, which has long been used in traditional medicine for its healing properties. We began using it as a companion plant in the garden to ward off pests. Sure enough, recent scientific studies have shown that the essential oil from this plant, like several others, is an extremely potent repellent to biting insects and other household pests such as ants and roaches. One study indicates that the oil of Nepeta cataria is actually 10 times stronger than DEET at repelling mosquitoes.  
We began to use it as a mosquito repellent for ourselves and were astonished at how effective it was. This plant became the only insect repellent we used as my children were growing up, including a trip to India and the Himalayas. We grew weary of waiting for a product to come to the market, and have simply been making our own for friends and family, using ingredients we trust and know to be a safe and healthy alternative to the toxic chemicals in many products on the market now. 


While humans have been making synthetic chemical insect repellents for less than a hundred years, plants have been devising ways to repel insects since the insects first showed up on earth and tried to eat them! Many of plants' repellent properties seem to work, not with toxic repellent ingredients, but through sophisticated chemical signaling which taps into insects' crucially-important sense of smell. In a way, plants use phytochemicals to negotiate with the insects rather than waging war on them. We like to think of our natural repellent as "insect diplomacy" rather than the old paradigm of chemical warfare. Whatever the exact mechanism, it works! And it works really well.

Wildthings has been field-tested by family and friends in the wilderness and urban jungles alike, from West Virginia to Chicago, from California to Bali. We are avid outdoors enthusiasts, and Wildthings travels with us every day during mosquito season for hiking, running and boating activities. It's been our invaluable companion on many a trip to mosquito-dense areas such as the Everglades, Assateague Island, and the lush river valleys of Oregon.

After 19 wonderful years at Cedarberry Farm in Pennsylvania, we have moved our small startup business to the Allegheny mountains of West Virginia. We are grateful for the community of artists, musicians, outdoors enthusiasts, and organic farmers that is thriving here, surrounded by spectacular wilderness.


Thank you for joining the movement toward a healthier future for ourselves, our children and the earth!

Lifelong field-testers, Austin and Jason, in the garden at Cedarberry Farm where it all started about 15 years ago.

Feel free to email us with questions  cedarberryfarm@gmail.com

You will also get the opportunity to sample our products and offer feedback. But more importantly, you are part of a movement toward a healthier way of living in relationship with nature and a belief that the natural world has deep wisdom that we simply need to remember and tap into. 
Our immediate goal is to provide the best possible products and to raise awareness of the efficacy of natural ingredients.  These products are not only healthier for our bodies and the earth, but we believe that they actually work better  than the synthetic, toxic alternatives. Our future goals include creating insect repelling products for the home as well as pets, reducing the chemical load our bodies are exposed to on a daily basis. 

We've tested and fine-tuned our bugspray recipes, and we have a website, which will open for online business in early December, as soon as the fundraising campaign ends: 

wildthingsbugspray.com

Now we need your help to get production rolling! *  5% of the  proceeds from our fundraiser will be donated to support charities we love...  Arcadia Center for Sustainable Food and Agriculture and Panthera



What we offer you...

As perks we are offering Wildthings bugspray as well as some of the natural body products that will be offered through our parent company, Cedarberry. AND, because we know the mosquito season is drawing to an end in the northern states, and there's only so much bugspray you can use this time of year, we are also offering some ART, T-shirts, and other curiosities to sweeten the deal! 
Wildthings insect repellent has a good shelf life, and will have you ready for next summer, but you are welcome to opt for delivery in the spring.
**We can only ship Wildthings insect repellent within the United States at this point.Galleries for the ART perks will go up in early November, with links posted here, and art will be added through the end of the campaign on November 29. Contributors will be able to choose their artwork when the galleries open or any time until December 15. Most of the art is from potion maker and founder, Monica Campbell, but a few pieces may be from other artists.


Some of the goodies included in our perks...


All of our perks for donations  $10 and more include a bottle of Wildthings bug repellent. Many also include a sample of our Cedarberry Body Products.





$ 25 donation or higher - Munky T-shirts! One of our favorite "wildthings" featured on an organic 100% cotton t-shirt. Children's and women's sizes available as well - 100% cotton American Apparel, but not organic . 
*T-shirts printed by the awesome folks at CustomInk



$25 donation or above - 100 % organic "feral" T-shirt and 1 bottle of Wildthings bugspray


Handmade, one of a kind ceramic mugs offered with the $35 thank you perk. Gallery is up, with more work being added over the next month:

http://www.wildthingsbugspray.com/projects/




$50. perk includes various other ceramic art pieces. 

Gallery is up, with more work being added throughout the month.

http://www.wildthingsbugspray.com/projects/



Small framed artworks are included in the $100 perk, along with T-shirt and Wildthings samples.

Gallery is up, and lots more painting will be added SOON!

http://www.wildthingsbugspray.com/projects/




larger art pieces are offered in Galleries 2 and 3 as part of the thank you perks






Backstory...

The story of our insect repellent began during our years working in our organic garden on a little farm in Pennsylvania. We noticed that one of the mint-family plants  that grew wild and abundant on our farm repelled garden pests astonishingly well, while beneficial insects like honeybees and butterflies loved the flowers. It was Nepeta cataria, commonly known as catmint or catnip, which has long been used in traditional medicine for its healing properties. We began using it as a companion plant in the garden to ward off pests. Sure enough, recent scientific studies have shown that the essential oil from this plant, like several others, is an extremely potent repellent to biting insects and other household pests such as ants and roaches. One study indicates that the oil of Nepeta cataria is actually 10 times stronger than DEET at repelling mosquitoes.  We began to use it as a mosquito repellent for ourselves and were astonished at how effective it was. This plant became the only insect repellent we used as my children were growing up, including a trip to India and the Himalayas. We grew weary of waiting for a product to come to the market, and have simply been making our own for friends and family, using ingredients we trust and know to be a safe and healthy alternative to the toxic chemicals in many products on the market now. 

While humans have been making synthetic chemical insect repellents for less than a hundred years, plants have been devising ways to repel insects since the insects first showed up on earth and tried to eat them! Many of plants' repellent properties seem to work, not with toxic repellent ingredients, but through sophisticated chemical signaling which taps into insects' crucially-important sense of smell. In a way, plants use phytochemicals to negotiate with the insects rather than waging war on them. We like to think of our natural repellent as "insect diplomacy" rather than the old paradigm of chemical warfare. Whatever the exact mechanism, it works! And it works really well.Wildthings has been field-tested by family and friends in the wilderness and urban jungles alike, from West Virginia to Chicago, from California to Bali. We are avid outdoors enthusiasts, and Wildthings travels with us every day during mosquito season for hiking, running and boating activities. It's been our invaluable companion on many a trip to mosquito-dense areas such as the Everglades, Assateague Island, and the lush river valleys of Oregon.After 19 wonderful years at Cedarberry Farm in Pennsylvania, we have moved our small startup business to the Allegheny mountains of West Virginia. We are grateful for the community of artists, musicians, outdoors enthusiasts, and organic farmers that is thriving here, surrounded by spectacular wilderness.
Thank you for joining the movement toward a healthier future for ourselves, our children and the earth!Lifelong field-testers, Austin and Jason, in the garden at Cedarberry Farm where it all started about 15 years ago.Feel free to email us with questions  cedarberryfarm@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

I am a breast cancer survivor who semi-retired in 2012 after being a consultant for over 30 years.  I relocated to Texas to be nearer to family and friends.  It didn't take very long to decide I wanted to do something different, so I opened a small coffee shop serving a limited breakfast and lunch.  I had done catering as a side job for years, so it seemed a natural fit.  A coffee shop can be the hub of a community, and that is my goal.  I am situated directly across from and elementary school and each morning serve breakfast to many of the kids before school starts...and parents drink our delicious coffee.  Many of the middle school and high school students stop by before catching the bus.  And it was through discussions with them that Teen Night was born.  We hope to expand Teen Night to be bigger and better with the funds raised to accommodate more teenagers in the future.  We will also be able to serve artisan pizza's and breads, which compliment the nature of Buffalo Gap.

What We Need & What You Get

Materials for the building expansion, including foundation and walls is approximately $2,000.  The relocation of the existing electric and plumbing is another $1,000.  The wood fired oven is $2,000....leaving about $100.00 for unexpected expenses.

"Thank You" items range from a cup of coffee (expressly blended for us) to a $100.00 gift certificate at the world famous Perini Ranch.  

The Impact

Small towns throughout the country are suffering for a variety of reasons.  The exodus of youth to larger towns and cities when they grow older is evidenced through boarded up homes, closed businesses, and declining populations.  It is important to show the youth that small towns can, and should, be a place to call home.  Therefore businesses need to not only succeed, but thrive.  It is also important to support the local economy through taxes paid that go directly back to the community to support it.  The funds raised through the effort will help demonstrate that there are things to do in a small town.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with your friends via Facebook, Twitter, Google+, email and word of mouth.  Your support, whether financial or a simple "wish you well" is most appreciated.
